results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early. Doors close at 8:10p.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact Aubrey at [masked]

If you can't make this one, visit www.turnonnyc.us for more
results.name: TurnON Manhattan

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

We start on time so please arrive fifteen minutes early.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For info contact Marissa at [masked]
results.name: TurnON Manhattan - SOHO

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
Mondays from 8 – 9:30 pm with Yasuko Kasaki (lecture)
Wednesdays from 7 – 8:30 pm with Christopher Pelham (lab)

Know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation clearly. Communicate with your Inner Teacher. Heal yourself and others.


These ongoing classes focus on mind training designed to help you to experience the lessons and wisdom of ACIM. 

Each Monday class contains some lecture from the ACIM Textbook and/or Urtext, some discussion and Q&A, and typically 20 – 30 minutes of meditation, creative visualization and/or spiritual reading practice in order to experience mind change.

Thursday classes skip the lecture to devote more time to discussion and practice.

Our primary goal in these classes is for each student to learn to listen to the guidance of Holy Spirit and live his/her life with certainty and peace. Slowly, you will re-train your eyes to see the world around you without judgment. You will learn to communicate with your holy spirit.

It is OK to attend without having done the reading, but we highly encourage you to do the reading (and the workbook lessons on your own) if you can! This course is meant to be experienced rather than simply talked about. You can find the text online here, among other places.

Students of all experience levels and backgrounds are welcome!

 

Yasuko Kasaki has been teaching A Course in Miracles and offering spiritual counseling and healing since 1999. She has approximately 1,000 students and clients. In 2004, she opened CRS, the first and only spiritual center in New York City devoted to the study and practice of ACIM. Ms. Kasaki is the author of 21 books published by major publishers in Japan. Read more...

You can listen to a sampling of Yasuko's recent guided meditations here:
http://crsny.podbean.com

Christopher Pelham currently serves as teaching assistant for the Monday class and will sometimes lead the group when Ms. Kasaki is away. He is the Director and a co-founder of CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing). He balances his time between overseeing the growth and health of the CRS community, producing arts/cultural/educational events at the Center, and working as a CRS Healer and student and teacher of A Course in Miracles. In addition to studying ACIM with Yasuko Kasaki since 2003, he studied the Spiritual Psychology of Acting with London-based teacher John Osborne Hughes and Keith Johnstone-based Improvisation with the late Gloria Maddox. Read more...

Another great way to get a taste of our approach is to attend one of our free Healing Events, each of which is open to the public:

Spiritual Healing Clinic 
M 7 – 7:50 pm, Tu 7 – 7:50 pm
Sundays 12 – 1 pm preceding Jon Mundy's Miracles in Manhattan lectures
suggested donation $20, nobody turned away

Guided Meditation
Tu 6:30 – 7 pm
Free!
results.why: It's a concrete and energizing way to develop the ability to meditate and to come to know your life purpose and the meaning of your current situation more clearly. You can also learn to communicate with your Inner Teacher and find peace!
results.how_to_find_us: It's located one block east of Broadway, one and half blocks south of Union Square, above Think Coffee shop.

In this class you will learn how to dance like a natural and unlock your inner beauty! You will learn how to respond to the music in a way that allows you to express your emotions through movement. All classes begin with a warm up consisting of the core movements, allowing you to develope your skills at your own pace. Wonderful friendly, accepting atmosphere, lots of encouragement and feedback! At Baladi Beat, you are never just another face in the crowd, but an individual!

results.description:
Join Lana for this creative, Shiva Rea inspired, vinyasa flow yoga class.  This is an all levels class with just the right amount of alignment cues and modifications to make it intuitive and appropriately challenging for beginners to advanced practitioners.  

The vinyasa style of yoga links the yoga poses (asanas) with the breath, focusing as much on the transitions from pose to pose, as on the actual poses.  This class starts with a mindful and centering warm-up, building into a moderately to fast paced yoga flow and allowing for deeper stretches and longer holds toward the end of the class. By the final pose, savasana, your body and mind will feel totally prepared to melt into a blissful state of peace and relaxation.

Pricing: $10.  

Please make an effort to arrive 5 to 15 minutes in advance of class and always RSVP (even if it's last moment).  If you need to be late, please walk-in and set up as quietly as you can.  Thank you.
results.name: Candlelit Vinyasa Yoga (with Lana)

results.description:
Guys, This meetup is to talk about the issues we each face. Some of the things that cause a lot of trouble: Problems with the ex. Harm to the children, and how to reduce it. If you have visitation and not custody, there are visitation problems we all deal with. Everyone pays child support. My idea is to kick around our problems and experiences, and see if that helps in dealing with the issues. I have changed the location for the meetup: at TGI Fridays 826 New Jersey 3 Clifton. This is a pretty nice TGI Fridays, and it is easy to get to.

Please come on time, and bring a friend with you. And please be ready to listen as well as ask questions.  This is a bunch of us who have been through it.  It is a good group!

see you then,

Bob Davies
results.how_to_find_us: You will see me at a table with a couple guys, sitting, talking, drinking a beer and relaxing!
results.name: The Divorcing Man's Support Group Monthly Meetup

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, get a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Mohit.)

(Co-leader- Chris W.)

results.description:
The Place: The recipient of 1 Michelin star, the Nomad serves American-European meals showcasing seasonal produce.

Menu is here:

https://www.thenomadhotel.com/#!/dining/menus/dinner

Daniel Humm is the chef/co-owner of Eleven Madison Park and The NoMad and NoMad Bar at The NoMad Hotel. His cuisine is focused on the locally sourced ingredients of New York, with an emphasis on simplicity, purity, and seasonal flavors.

As always:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Nomad Dining Room

results.description:
At 9pm, we will end our business meeting, and have a brief introductory discussion about freeganism. Newcomers are always welcome and encouraged to attend our full meeting, but if you just want an introduction to freeganism, you can come just for the Freeganism 101 discussion.  The trailblaze will focus on an area we don't visit as often and is for foragers interested in helping to update our list of locations to recommend to others - it is different from our regular tours in that we do not know what we will find, although our experience is that wasteful patterns occur all over the city, with this neighborhood being no exception. The meeting and tour are NOT open to media.

We'll meet in Teardrop Park in the Battery Park City area. Enter the park on the west side of North Avenue between Warren and Murray, and look for us with a sign. If you have trouble finding us, call Janet at (347) 724-6954. See the map for a better idea of where to enter. In case of rain, we'll meet in the Winter Garden atrium with the palm trees at Brookfield Place (formerly World Financial Center) at 200 Vesey Street.
results.how_to_find_us: Teardrop Park in the Battery Park City area. Enter the park on the west side of North Avenue between Warren and Murray, and look for us with a sign.
results.name: Freeganism 101 and Trash Trailblaze

results.description:
We are an independent referrals group dedicated to the business growth of each of our members.  We welcome one member per business category in our membership.    Our 15 members are friendly and focused on supporting one another.  We'd like to grow to 20-25 members - will you join us?

This Meetup group helps us reach business professionals like you.  We welcome guests to visit us in order to network, get to know us, and decide if there's a membership 'fit'.

As an independent group, our dues stay with us and we use them to invest in our weekly meetings with a hot breakfast - as well as public networking events and member-only professional development programs.

Our 'rules' are relaxed compared to other referral groups.  For example, we don't require a sub if you can't make a meeting and our attendance policy allows for an occasional absence.  Instead of fines, we reward our members when they bring in guests.

We don't have a 'requirement' to bring in a referral every single week because we only want qualified introductions - and we know that a connection for another member may not show itself every single week.

We meet weekly to generate solid business referrals for each other. Join us and we’ll talk up your business, too. Partners in Business members have one focus . . . to exchange qualified business referrals.

We cater to the early morning professional, meeting on Tuesdays from 7:00-8:30am.  RSVP and be our GUEST at the next scheduled meeting. For further details, please see our website at Partners in Business.

results.description:
Malaysian plantation palm oil is an unsustainable fuel and food oil that contributes to climate change, wildlife destruction, and the displacement of indigenous peoples. The Malaysian palm oil trade is also one of several Malaysian industries exploiting human trafficking victims for forced labor.

Outrageously, on Monday, July 27th, the State Department upgraded Malaysia from Tier 3 to Tier 2 on the Trafficking in Persons list in a cynical ploy to circumvent legislation prohibiting Fast Tracking of trade deals with Tier 3 nations. Malaysia is one of the 12 nations negotiating the Trans-Pacific Partnership, so Malaysia's Tier 3 status would have prevented TPP from being Fast Tracked. Human rights group are outraged by the upgrade, which comes just two months after the discovery of human trafficking camps and mass graves of trafficked person in Malaysia.

On Tuesday, August 4th, Secretary of State John Kerry will be travelling to Malaysia for a series of meetings. Join us for a press conference and rally on the first day of his trip at the Malaysian Consulate-General in New York, where we will tell Secretary Kerry, President Obama, Congress, the Obama Administration, the Malaysian government, and the media that we will not allow human rights and the environment to be compromised in the name of "free trade!"

SUBWAY DIRECTIONS:
4, 5, 6, or 7 to 42nd Street Grand Central Terminal.


BUS DIRECTIONS: M42 to 2rd Avenue.


Learn more at

http://gjae.org/?page=Malaysia

http://tradejustice.net/tpptrafficking

www.ExposeTheTPP

Write to Congress at:

http://bit.ly/TPPTrafficking

PLEASE ALSO JOIN US FOR THESE EVENTS!
 

Wed, 8/5, 9:00 PM:  National TPP Resistance Call

Thurs, 8/6, 10:00 AM:  TradeJustice Thursday on Event Horizons Radio: Maui TPP Talks Fail! Customs Enforcement Conference Committee Postponed! Kerry in Malaysia!

Thurs, 8/6, 6:30 PM:  TradeJustice Meeting: After Maui: What's Next in the Fight to Kill TPP?
results.name: EMERGENCY RALLY/PRESS CONF.: Kerry: No Slavery for Palm Oil! No Coverup for TPP!

results.description:
This months topic: The Process of Change

Lunch (whenever)-12:15*
Conversation 12:15-1:15

https://images.duckduckgo.com/iu/?u=http%3A%2F%2Fcdn2-b.examiner.com%2Fsites%2Fdefault%2Ffiles%2Fstyles%2Fimage_content_width%2Fhash%2F00%2F84%2F1362032783_4537_Change1.jpg%3Fitok%3DdMjfy-le&f=1

Everybody says they want to change, but how many actually do it?  How many of your New Years resolutions did you keep?!?

The process of change is actually very well defined and predictable by both the hard and soft sciences. So why does it appear to run amok in actual human application?!?

What is the key to mastering this process?  How can you harness it's energy to make your life better?

Lets get together and chat about the process and how it plays out in human behavior.  What are common blocks, barriers and boosters to this process?

On-line resources will be available to help us move this conversation along.  Contemplation beforehand will yield a more focused and lively discussion when we get together.  Access to on-line content will be emailed out to all RSVP's 2 weeks before the MeetUp.


* Food - Charlotte's has a breakfast and lunch menu, excellent coffee and their pastry chef trained in Paris.

 

 

About the Moderator:

Ken Campbell, President, International College of Healing Arts.

Ken's experience comes from over 30 years of front line experience in health and human services as a paramedic, nurse, nurse practitioner and now President and Senior Faculty of the International College of Healing Arts. During this time he has personally been there and helped with births, deaths and almost everything in between.

He has worked in remote outdoor locations, on urban streets, in field hospitals at Woodstock 94 & 99, IronMan and other events, outpatient clinics, nursing homes and extensively in the Emergency Room. He has traveled the 4 corners of the globe perusing knowledge of the Healing Arts and has practiced and taught on 5 continents.
results.name: The Process of Change . . .  (B'Klyn)

results.description:
The classic Felix Salter story Bambi provides the basis for this near-perfect Disney animated feature. We follow the male deer Bambi from birth, through his early childhood experiences with woodland pals Thumper the rabbit and Flower the skunk, the traumatic sudden death of Bambi's mother at the hands of hunters, his courtship of the lovely doe Faline, and his rescue of his friends during a raging forest fire; we last see the mature, antlered Bambi assuming his proper place as the Prince of the Forest. In the grand Disney tradition, Bambi is brimming with unforgettable sequences, notably the young deer's attempts to negotiate an iced-over pond, and most especially the death of Bambi's mother--and if this moment doesn't move you to tears, you're made of stone (many subsequent Disney films, including Lion King, have tried, most in vain, to match the horror and pathos of this one scene). The score in Bambi yielded no hits along the lines of "Whistle While You Work", but the songs are adroitly integrated into the action. Bambi was the last of the "classic" early Disney features before the studio went into a decade-long doldrums of disjointed animated pastiches like Make Mine Music.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nLvX-erABqY


***I am a MOMA member and can get up to 5 reduced guest tickets ($6 instead of $12). I will buying tickets in the next few days, so if you want me to get you a ticket, you must let me know right away.

YPRC has been such a driving force in the kayaking world. the educational programs, the environmental support. Linda and i as well as several other liquid skies members are also YPRC members, if you are not a member, come down and meet them, once you do, i think you will be eager to lend a hand to protect such a valuable resource. they are a tremendous positive force in the kayaking community. - George

Next week National Night Out takes place at Kennedy Marina.  We have participated in many of the previous celebrations at other locations with just a table and a boat.  This year it comes to the home of our most visible Public Program.  The expectation is that there will be large crowds and many dignitaries present.  We will run our normal Thursday Free kayaking program on that Tuesday from 6-8:30.  To handle the large number of people, maintain order, and look professional we will need more than the usual number of volunteers.  Phil has requested that Aug. 4 Tuesday's guided paddle be cancelled and the many beneficiaries be strongly encouraged to help at Kennedy.  there will be many jobs on land to help move people through the process.  This would also free up the usual guides to help on water (or at the ramp where water smarts really count also).  

the above was send out by John Maggiotto, commodor YPRC.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Join this session to learn how to use Puppet to provision virtual machines in the Google Cloud Platform - from installation, configuration, to creating a cluster of servers.  With Puppet, you can instantiate a fleet of Google Compute Engine virtual machine instances with specific software configurations, disk, network, machine size, authorization scope, metadata, and more.


Finally, after launching a fleet of servers, use Puppet to configure a load balancer to distribute incoming requests.

Speaker Bio

Ray Tsang is a Developer Advocate for the Google Cloud Platform. Ray had extensive hands on cross-industry enterprise systems integration delivery and management experiences during his time at Accenture, managed full stack application development, DevOps, and ITOps. Ray specialized in middleware, big data, and PaaS products during his time at Red Hat while contributing to open source projects, such as Infinispan. Aside from technology, Ray enjoys traveling and adventures.
results.name: Puppet 101 with Google Compute Engine (Beginner)

Technically, alcohol is not permitted in the park, but cups with unidentified beverages in them have not be a problem.  (Just be discreet.)  People often bring snacks to share with the group.

results.description:
Come drop in with us this Tuesday with Al and Oriya, as they take you on a musical and lyrical ride.  Al will be playing the musical melody on guitar and Oriya will be streaming a meditative lyrical invitation to just BE.

Come play with the community and see what this exploration creates in your life.



Get support on your journey home.  


The waking journey has many paths, roads and communities. We are not "a" community, we are merely practicing it... 

Come join us here for an evening where we sanctify time itself and re-claim our inner-space as sacred and get community support on the journey home - the freedom to format our life around what we love and be supported by it. 

We don't have too many ideas for the evening, we just wanna to consistently show up and build community. 

Our favorite idea so far is to use the space to consistency feature different community offerings, artists, musicians, comedians, poets and soul teachers.

Now, with a strong foundation and community support, we can gently open up to the world and express our gifts and love.

The world is ready to experience and succeed at community building, that's a real conversation to be having. 

If you want to do/be/offer in any of the upcoming weekly Public Tuesday Nights, let me know.. the schedule is filling up already, tell us which Tuesday and a the general idea of your expression. 

My initial evening structure format (idea): I start with 10-20 minutes intro, then the artist / practitioner / magician does their magic -  and then we move on to a joint questions & answers session... this keeps it flexible and with room for everyone. 

We will use donations to pay for the space with the rest going to the scholarship fund.

This is the magical unfolding of intention, structure and support.
results.name: Being Community through Presence & Self-Love

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play. 
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

results.description:
This weeks movie will be Vacation , I have purchased seat E10 for the 7pm show and plan to be at the theater by 6:30pm. Last week I bought a gift card at the theater and was able to buy my ticket online w/o paying the $1.25 fee I suggest all of you doing this if you want to it's like getting your 5th movie free!

Ok who LOVES the movies as much as me? Who has a limited entertainment budget like me? LOL Well this is the event for YOU!

My local theater has discount Tuesday every week and if you sign up online they will even send you a coupon for the concession stand, each week a different one (this weeks is free small popcorn with a drink purchase). They also have those awesome new reclining seats! And you get to choose and pay for your seat in advance so there is no rushing in at the last minute and sitting in the front row and straining your neck!  Here is the link to the theater for more details: http://www.cinemark.com/theatre-detail.aspx?node_id=83854

So here is how it's going to work each week. I will choose a movie when the new schedule goes out (Thur/Fri) and choose the movie and showtime. I will buy my seat online and post what row and number. Those of you who wish to join me can buy your seat near me. There are two ways to buy seats: 1) online in advance is your best bet but there is a $1.25 service fee per ticket 2) At the theater no service fee but you really need to driver there in advance if you want seats near us. OR you can just show up that night and sit wherever there is space available.

 Hope to see YOU at the movies!!  Love, Cassie

if you can't make it, no need to post why. We understand and will catch you next time!

Also if time allows those who wish we can go to The Broad Street Diner in Keyport for dinner before the show they have a great two for $20 special

Stretch, Do a mini Exercise Boot Camp and LEARN to Play SOCCER. 

for BEGINNERS 

If you are an advanced Soccer player, you are welcome to join in the drills and exercise and play in our beginner game at the end of the session. Bring a ball. 

!!!!! Sign up fast, Only 25 spaces open for this event.  We Encourage first timers to come out and have fun!

PS Ladies, We always have too many men! :-)

Ladies and Gentlemen, you will be learning some basic techniques, getting Boot Camp style exercise and play in a fun easy going SOCCER GAME the first day ! WOOOHOOO !!!

LADIES: Maybe this will be your soccer partner for the lesson!

      Or GUYS, Maybe this will be your partner for the soccer game! Hmmm....

SCHEDULE:


We will stretch for the first 5 minutes

10 minutes of passing, receiving and ball handling drills

then we will play a "BEGINNER ONLY"game until the sun sets behind us!  :-)

IF YOU ARE A MORE ADVANCED PLAYER, YOU MUST BRING YOUR OWN BALL AS WE WILL ONLY HAVE BALLS FOR THE BEGINNERS TO USE IN BOOT CAMP.

WHAT YOU NEED TO BRING ! Water, Snacks if you havent had dinner before you arrive.!

You also need to bring your cross trainers, running shoes or turf cleats, shorts or exercise pants.

DIRECTIONS :::  B or C SubwayTrain to 103rd street, walk South 3 Blocks to100st St. and walk into CENTRAL PARK

Try to be there before 6:15pm! We will be finished at 7:45pm.


************************************************************

George, Fit and Fun Organizer 


FIT AND FUN SINGLES !

results.description:
There are new rules and <a>regulations</a> concerning the Tuesday <a>night</a> games. Please scroll down and read them all before signing up for the event.


There may not be space for you if you don't.


<a>Table</a> Top Role <a>Playing</a> Game Night!


This is the official <a>RPG game</a> night of the NY SciFi/Fan Meetup Group.

Every Tuesday night we get together to indulge in <a>Table Top RPGs</a>. There are <a>multiple games</a> going on at once, so getting involved in a game is <a>easy</a>.


For those of you unfamiliar with the term, a Table Top RPG (Role <a>Playing</a> Game) is a type of game where the players create characters based on the  story/system available and one person acts as a storyteller. Everyone interacts and works together to <a>create a story</a> and have a few laughs as well.


New Rules for Signing Up:


How to <a>sign up</a>: There will be at leas two <a>games running</a> each week.  You will be able to see who is running, what games are being <a>played</a>, and who is <a>playing</a> below. There will be a total of six spots <a>open</a> in each game, so if a game has filled up you will not be able to join that game. 


When you <a>sign up</a>, leave a comment stating which game you would like to participate in and your name will be added to the roster. If you would like to leave a game or switch over to another game in <a>progress</a>, simply speak to Justin or Cat. They will let you know if there is <a>open</a> space to do so.


If it is your first time <a>attending</a> a game, we have pre-made characters for you to <a>select</a> from. Beginning on your third RPG event, you may choose to make an original character for whatever game you're currently participating in.


Can I run my own game?: If you would like to run your own game, please contact Justin or Cat to reserve a slot.


Need Dice?: Please bring yours if you have some if you need extra I will provide some.

Cat, Steve and Myself will be available to run.
results.name: NY SciFi & Fantasy Tabletop Role Playing and Game Night

results.description:
Career Paths for Women in Tech


Fifty-six percent of women in technology companies leave their organizations at the mid-level point of their careers (10-20 years). Many leave because of the culture and lack of other women in leadership roles. 

When women don’t see other women in the higher echelons of tech, it takes away not only a tangible, visible goal toward which to aspire, but it also makes it much harder to find an empathetic mentor.

So, what career paths can we follow as women?


Through our topic, Careers Paths for Women in Tech, we will explore our own observations, experiences, obstacles and successes in the tech industry. Let's inspire women to aim high and stay in tech. 


The Panelists:

Arlie Sisson leads the Emerging Products Group at Conde Nast. She is singularly focused on innovating for the company’s future and currently that means implementing a mobile first product strategy. Previous to that she was responsible for the mobile native app strategy at Starwood Resorts and Hotels. She joined Starwood from a mobile start up, where she led and launched 32 applications across 5 mobile platforms. The work Arlie has lead has been include in 7 Apple Keynotes including one just last month. Arlie’s passion for the ever-changing digital landscape allows her to advance product strategies through native applications whether that’s a phone, tablet, wallet offering and even wearable tech. Follow her @arliej.

Lisa van Gelder is the VP of Engineering at Stride. Lisa has 15 years experience in software engineering, including leading and managing software development teams. Her career has taken her between London and New York at companies ranging from small startups to large media organizations, including the Guardian and the BBC.

Nathalie Molina Niño is the CRO at Power to Fly. Keith Ferrazzi called her a “super-connector” in his updated best-selling classic, Never Eat Alone. Nathalie Molina Niño is the “fuel core of a network that makes it easy for her to tap the resources to get stuff done, and done quickly.” Most recently, Nathalie stepped in as Chief Revenue Officer of PowerToFly, a high-growth startup aimed at closing the gender gap in tech.

</a><a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/helen-altshuler/2/677/24b">Helen Altshuler is PeerIQ’s Chief Technology Officer, focused on growing engineering team and building the firm’s data andanalytics products. PeerIQ is an early stage fintech startup that aims to increase transparency in the peer to peer lendingsector through innovative technology and financial analytics. Previously Helen worked as an Executive Director and Head ofTechnology Delivery at JP Morgan, building technology platforms in big data and analytics, consumer products, credit andmarket risk management, and FX and derivatives areas of the firm.

Claudina Sarahe is an entrepreneur. Her background is in front-end web development with a focus on large, scale web applications and sites. She's worked for Pop Art, The New Group, The Huffington Post, New York Road Runners, and Method. She's lead front-end development for sites such for FEI.com, Charlie Rose, PBS, Scholastic, Count Me In, and LocalVox. She lead the strategy and initial product development for Vestify, a crowdfunding web application for entrepreneurs powering the MassChallenge Global Start-Up. She was one of the founding members of UNICEF Innovation. 
She organizes the monthly New York City Sass and Compass Meetup. In 2010 Claudina Sarahe developed a pilot program to teach development to less advantaged high schoolers in the Dominican Republic. She is a 2012 StartupBus aluma. A firm believer in a balanced lifestyle she keeps her mind and body elastic with Bikram Yoga, Crossfit, and biking NYC streets.
results.name: Panel @Condé Nast: Career Paths for Women in Tech

results.description:
THE EMOTIONAL PATTERN OF PLOT with Linda Cowgill

Mastering Plot Series: Seminar # 1

In this lecture, screenwriter and professor Linda Cowgill will examine ways to incorporate emotion into your plot to strengthen characterization and the audience's response to your story. When writers think about plot we focus on action and conflict to define it. But many writers concentrate so much on the protagonist's active goal they neglect the emotional side of the story. As a result characterizations suffer. Drama is as much about reaction, the repercussions of action, as it is about action. Plot is more than just an outline of events, it's the ordering of emotions to build your characters and strengthen their relationships. Learn to define the emotional pattern of plots for screenplays and teleplays.

Film & TV clips she will analyze include: Breaking Bad, Spiderman, American Beauty, Jaws

PRICE: $25 discounted to $15 for NYCSC members.

WHEN: Tuesday, August 4th 6:30p-9pm  

(Sold out crowd expected, event begins at 7pm, arrive early to claim your seat.)

WHERE: Adorama 42 W 18th St (bet 5th & 6th Ave) New York, NY 10011

LINDA COWGILL is an author of the books The Art of Plotting, Writing Short Films, and Secrets of Screenplay Structure, has written for film and television. She lectures around the country, and has taught at AFI, Loyola Marymount University, the Boston Film Institute, and currently heads the screenwriting faculty at the Los Angeles Film School.


Presented by NYC Screenwriters Collective​, The M/E/T, and Adorama​.
results.name: THE EMOTIONAL PATTERN OF PLOT with Linda Cowgill - (Mastering Plot Series #1)

results.description:
The Rise of Brand Journalism:
Panel Discussion with Experts in Content Marketing


The growing interest in content marketing has been formalized by the creation of groups-within brands, at publishing companies and at marketing services agencies-to approach the development of branded content not only strategically, but systematically and continuously, tackling it essentially as journalists in what has come to be called a "brand newsroom" environment (complete with writers, editors fact checkers and the like).

Join us August 4 for an interactive panel discussion moderated byMike Winkleman, president of the content marketing agency Leverage Media and a former chair of the Content Council. 

Our panel of experienced practitioners will discuss:

• How it works

• Who's doing it 

• What sort of content is being created 

• How it's being distributed

What value it's bringing in

Panelists are experienced in running brand newsrooms for brands, PR firms and publishing companies-and cover this phenomenon for the trade press.

Moderator

Mike Winkleman - Leverage Media

Mike is president and chief creative officer of Leverage Media, a Hastings-on-Hudson, NY-based content marketing firm that creates a wide range of branded publications for law firms and businesses. He is a former chairman of The Content Council and the recipient of the CC's 2013 John Caldwell Lifetime Achievement Award.

Panelists

Caysey Welton - Media Industry News 

Caysey is group editor at Media Industry Newsletter, where he oversees all editorial operations. He previously served as senior editor at Folio: magazine and still contributes to the brand regularly. Caysey was previously a critically acclaimed chef.

Tyler Gray - Edelman

As senior vice president, editorial director, Tyler is head of Edelman's Collaborative Journalism group. He is responsible for helping conceive, create and promote a wide variety of stories-both planned and responsive-in every format on a wide variety of channels and platforms for clients in the corporate, digital, financial services, consumer, B2B and social purpose worlds. Previously Tyler was editorial director at Fast Company magazine and an editor at Blender, Radar, Men's Fitness and Men's Journal.

Tomas Kellner - GE 

Tomas has been the managing editor of GE Reports, GE's digital news magazine since October 2011. He oversees the publication's daily and long-term content strategy and works closely with GE teams as well outside agencies to tell compelling business, technology, and innovation stories about GE. His career in journalism includes eight years at Forbes, where he covered business and technology.

Ann Marinovich - Forbes BrandVoice

Ann is vice president, Advertising Products and Strategy at Forbes Media. She is responsible for leading the company's digital, mobile, and print advertising products and strategy across Forbes's integrated product line. This includes Forbes BrandVoice, Forbes' award-winning content marketing platform. Marinovich has been integral in the ongoing evolution of BrandVoice's market strategy, product development, sales strategy, client services, analytics and more.

Registration


$50 Members of NY Business Communicators Meetup ($10 discount rate)


$60 Non-Members rate

$40 Members of NY-IABC rate - Join IABC and get members rate for this and future NY-IABC Events!!


Wine and light refreshments will be served

RSVP / Register by: 12:00 PM, August 4

NOTE: Advance registration is required.  No walk-ins will be permitted. 

The International Association of Business Communicators provides a professional network to help advance your career. The New York Chapter of IABC brings members together from a wide variety of industries and communication disciplines to share their expertise with one another through a broad range of networking and professional development activities.

Visit the New York IABC chapter website to learn more.

results.description:
This is such a fun wine tasting! If you are new to wine or a die hard fan, this is a great experience for all! Walk from table to table at your own pace to sample each wine.  

You will get a wine glass that you can have filled as many times as you'd like.  There are 3 tables or stations where they will be pouring the wines and explaining each one.  There is also a table full of appetizers! 

Socialize and network in a relaxed atmosphere during one of our very popular walk around wine tasting events. Unlike other wine tastings where you are stuck at one table, this walk around format gives you the opportunity to easily meet other members and wine enthusiasts.   

You will enjoy up to 24 different wines all carefully explained by Vinoversity’s friendly and knowledgeable sommeliers. Just $29 to taste 24 wines (normally $33).  Price will go up as event gets closer.

PREPAY ONLY EVENT. Must purchase ticket in advance at this link below (no tickets sold at door) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-04-2015_at_0630PM

What kinds of wine/apps?  24 whites, reds, sparklers, rose's, & dessert wines. These wines will not disappoint, and will amaze you with their unique flavors, styles, and mineralities. A super tasting from an incredible wine region! Complimentary cheeses, dips, olives, & flatbreads will be served. 

Can I come alone?  Yes 90%  attending come on their own. 

Do I need to know about wine? No, most come for socializing, learning and the enjoyment of wine.

What's dress code? Wear what you had on at work.  It is a casual and comfortable atmosphere. 

Who will be there? We will have 15+ members of our group attending an event that will have 50+ others there.

What are the ages?  This is non-age specific event.  We'll have a good mix of ages 20s-50s. Everyone always seems to find people in their peer group to hang and taste with. 

Do I have to buy a ticket in advance?  Yes.  Space is limited. This a Prepay Only Event. Get tickets here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wine414/dates/Aug-04-2015_at_0630PM
results.name: Wine Tasting Social - Enjoy 24 Wines + Comp Apps (Prepay Only)

Monthly dev hack night. We'll begin with two 10 minute lightning talks and then highlight an open source project along with how it can be contributed to. Doors open at 6:30, talks start at 7pm, followed by open hack time for the rest of the night. 

1. Jake Foster - Custom Color Schemes

Color scheming, as the WordPress Codex says, is like painting a house. 

Unfortunately, there is an indefinite number of ways you can paint a house. This talk covers a two possible approaches to crafting custom color schemes within WordPress with a focus on using metadata and SASS maps.

-------

Project: Testing/patching the WordPress 4.3 Release Candidate

We'll check out the upcoming WP 4.3 release and look for and/or fix bugs to get them into core before it comes out in a couple of weeks.

results.description:
Join William from Couchbase to learn about mobile trends.  We will answer the question of:


What happens when your mobile device does not have a network connection? That device will have no content, no experience and the amazing application that you spent so much effort to build just simply will not work.


You will gain knowledge in NoSQL databases technologies and walk away with insights on how to create offline type of applications that to sync to the cloud with Couchbase Mobile.


Couchbase Mobile is a thin client library that would help developers with their mobile projects in creating a local data layer for offline user experience and will provide fast sync capabilities when there is available network connectivity.
______________________________________________________
Meet over the 10th floor of Library For All | www.libraryforall.org | 164 West 25th Street, 10th Floor, New York, NY 10001

results.description:
Back to the core of Julia this month as we feature Jeff Bezanson.

About the talk:

Jeff will talk about recent and upcoming developments in the Julia language – its type system, higher-order programming, static analysis and more. If you were at JuliaCon and caught his keynote, some of this will be repeated, but there have been some developments since then too. If you missed JuliaCon, this is a great chance to see Jeff's talk in person.

About Jeff:

Jeff is one of the co-creators of Julia, as well as a co-founder of Julia Computing, Inc. (juliacomputing.com), providing support, training and consulting for Julia and its ecosystem. He recently finished his PhD at MIT on the theory and implementation of Julia's type system.

Pizza starts at 6:30, Jeff goes on at 7 and then we'll head to a local bar after.
results.name: The base Julia language: future directions and speculations

results.description:
Given by Yasuko Kasaki
Tuesdays from 6:30 – 7 pm
Free

Please join us in the sharing of miracles. Here, your mind can come to rest and you can remember true peace. No experience with meditation is required, and everyone is welcome. We ask only that you make it your intention to sit still, quiet in body and mind, and to listen to; receive and follow my instruction to the best of your ability. You will learn to meditate as you practice. Please arrive for Meditation before 6:30 pm as we don't open our door from 6:30 - 7 pm while meditation is in progress. Kindly refrain from ringing our buzzer during this time.

We at CRS are dedicated teachers and students of A Course in Miracles (ACIM) who are waiting to share miracles with you through our ACIM Healing. We ask the Holy Spirit to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and we share forgiveness and bear witness to the miracles that are happening in your life. Each week I will share with you a different inspirational message from Holy Spirit. This may take the form of creative visualization exercises, or instruction about the nature and purpose of meditation, or about our true nature and relationship to ourselves, to one another, and to the world. In a sense, this is both a meditation practice and a meditation class.

Some students have been coming regularly for a number of years. Others drop in and out as they have time or need. Some come to learn and grow, others more so simply to calm down, to take time out from the frenetic pace of their busy lives. If you are new and feeling uncertain or shaky, do not hesitate to introduce yourself to some of the other students, to ask questions before or after. Try to observe and emulate the stillness and concentration of others around you whom you sense are most grounded. Soon, you, in turn, may provide inspiration and guidance for others.

While the principles are based on ACIM, it does not matter if you are unfamiliar with ACIM or are not prepared to study it outside of this meditation. You can still take from this practice some very practical, effective lessons, tools, and experiences that can enable you to lead a more peaceful, purposeful, fulfilling and loving life.

Namaste,

Yasuko Kasaki,
Founder
CRS (Center for Remembering & Sharing)
123 4th Ave, 2nd FL (between 12th & 13th streets, above Think Coffee)
New York, NY 10003
[masked]
www.crsny.org
results.name: ACIM-Based Guided Meditation

results.description:
Learn How to Get out of the Rat Race! 

Cashflow 101 is a fun way to learn the basic concepts of Real estate Investing. Your objective throughout the night will be to get out of the rat race and into the fast track! In other words you have to find a way to get out of that 9-5 that we all dislike and step into the life you always wanted to live.

How do you get out of the race race you ask?

Your total monthly passive income has to be higher than your total monthly expenses.

Cashflow 101 is an educational tool in board game format which aims to teach the players concepts of investing by having their money work for them in a risk free setting (play money) while simultaneously increasing financial literacy and stressing the imperative nature of accountability.


There are two stages to the game. In the first, "the rat race", the player aims to raise his or her character's passive income level to where it exceeds the character's expenses. The winner is determined in the second stage, "the fast track". To win, a player must get his or her character to buy their "dream" or accumulate an additional $50,000 in monthly cash flow.

In place of “score cards”, there are financial statements. The game requires the players to fill out their own financial statements so that they can see more clearly what is happening with their money. It generally shows how assets generate income and demonstrates that liabilities and 'doodads' are expenses.
results.name: NY/NJ Cash Flow game night

Great News! We are co-sponsoring the musical vents in conjunction with the Exhibit, Folk City: New York and the Folk Music Revival, at the Museum of the City of New York. Here are the details, and a DISCOUNT code!

Buy tickets here

• Follow the above link.

• Register

• Choose the type and # of tickets

• click "will call" or " eticket"

• at the very last page, the purchase page, there is a place to enter the code FOLK.

The Down Hill Strugglers & the Four o'clock Flowers in Concert

Tuesday, August 4 at 6:30 pm

Join the Down Hill Strugglers and the Four o’clock Flowers for a lively evening of old-time blues and gospel music by two outstanding, NYC-based contemporary folk groups.

Both play in an exuberant style influenced by American southern and western rural traditions. The Strugglers will be joined by legendary musician John Cohen, originally of the New Lost City Ramblers, a trio of “citybillies” who, in the 1950s and 1960s, introduced many New Yorkers to Southern mountain and bluegrass music. Between songs, Cohen and Eli Smith of the Strugglers will talk about their efforts to enrich the musical tapestry of New York with rural string-band, blues, and other forms of folk music. This concert accompanies the City Museum's exhibition  Folk City: New York and the Folk Music Revival, on view through January 10th.
results.name: The Down Hill Strugglers & the Four o'clock Flowers in Concert

results.description:
Shipping a website or application to production has its own challenges, but when it gets the right traction, it’s a great accomplishment. It always feels good to see the visitor numbers going up, doesn’t it? Except, of course, when your traffic increases so much that it crashes your little LAMP stack.

But fear not! There are ways to make your PHP application much more reliable and consistent. If the term scalability crossed your mind, you've got the right idea.

This talk will try to demystify the term "scalability" and show in practical terms what are the steps necessary to build PHP applications that can be horizontally scaled, using a real world application as example.


==

Erika Heidi is a web developer / devOp working with PHP and Linux for over a decade. Author of the Vagrant Cookbook and open source projects like phansible.com and dev-human.org, she worked many years as an independent developer, experimenting with a large diversity of projects and tools. Erika is an active open source contributor, speaker and writer, working as developer advocate for DigitalOcean.


==

Food and drink will be provided by Digital Ocean.
results.how_to_find_us: Check-in at the security desk, take the right bank of elevators to the 30th floor, follow the signs.
results.name: Horizontally Scaling PHP Applications

Franck Muhel/ Born in Martinique, Franck’s performances are renowned for their dynamic creative energy that inspires and electrifies audiences all over the world. As principal dancer with Eddie Torres, the Mambo King, and featured soloist, Franck has performed with internationally accl

aimed orchestras: Eddie Torres Mambo Kings Orchestra, Frankie Morales Orchestra, Jimmy Delgado Orchestra, Jimmy Bosch Orchestra, Orlando Marin Orchestra, Roberto Rodriguez Band, Eddie Montalvo Band, Frankie Vasquez & Los Soneros Del Barrio, Bobby Sanabria and more... www.Franckmuhel.com

Sophie Cazeneuve/ Native of France, She competed successfully in France and Europe in International Latin and Standard . In France, Sophie discovered West Coast Swing, which she became madly passionate about. She won the French Open WCS Showcase in 2010 and placed in a few Jack and Jill. She also competed in salsa on 2 ( 8th place at the World Sa

lsa Cup in Las Vegas, 2011).

Afterwards, she decided to move to New York to further pursue her passion of dancing. She is now teaching Latin dances, west coast swing, salsa and wedding dances in New York. Sophie is currently competing professionally in American Rhythm and Smooth.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A-X1L-flvzc

results.description:
In this group, you'll learn new ways of communicating in order to share more vulnerably and openly, bring attention more fully to the present in order to discover the richness of whats happening in relationship with others, and begin to see and co-explore aspects of yourself you may have been unaware of before in service of greater self-understanding, expression and awareness.  

You'll have the opportunity to learn and use new tools to participate in circles by sharing yourself, understanding others, and growing in both enjoyment of and capacity for presence and deep connection.

The more Ive seen people Circle the more genuine, " in the moment" conversations Ive seen become possible for them.

Likewise, the more Ive seen them become comfortable in their own skin, get clear on what their feeling, wanting or needing in any moment, grow in a sense of presence and natural interest in others, and generally embody a deep capacity for presence and authenticity.

If connecting profoundly with others, developing present moment awareness, and learning new communication skills inspires you, come try Circling out! 

The cost is $20

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call

results.description:
We will be near the piano, come look for us.

 

Let's tame some idioms and some accents !!

This week we're continuing with a combined session: about half our time taming idioms as usual, and the second half working on accent reduction and pronunciation.

All our native tongues introduce elements that we bring to learning English as a Second Language. Let's continue talking and freely discussing these roots of our "accent and pronunciation problems” and see what we can do about them. They can be a source of pride in your heritage and identity, but still you may want to reduce them somewhat to be better understood in English. Let’s take a look together, and find your comfort zone!

In this and future sessions, we’ll listen to individual people's concerns and problems with their own speech, and their difficulty in understanding others talking English. All who like will have an opportunity to speak and be open to the polite, good-natured responses of the group.

Please come if you feel comfortable talking about your own speaking and accent problems and would enjoy the give and take  of the rest of the group about theirs. Tell us what you feel are your biggest concerns, what letters, combinations of sounds, whatever bothers you the most. If you come and decide not to take a turn speaking, that's cool too. There will be other occasions in the future when you may feel bolder to try.

This is a work in progress and we’ll change the format as we see how we do.

Let’s tame some idioms AND some accents!
results.name: Taming Idioms and Accents and Other Wild Animals !!!

Hot on the heels of last year’s summer blockbuster, Battle of Gods, Dragon Ball Z is back in theaters. Dragon Ball Z: Resurrection ‘F’ is the second film personally supervised by the series creator himself, Akira Toriyama. The new movie showcases the return of Frieza – one of the most iconic villains of all time.

Even the complete obliteration of his physical form can’t stop the galaxy’s most evil overlord. After years in spiritual purgatory, Frieza has been resurrected and plans to take his revenge on the Z-Fighters of Earth. Facing off against Frieza’s powerful new form, and his army of 1,000 soldiers, Goku and Vegeta must reach new levels of strength in order to protect Earth from their vengeful nemesis.


FriezaFrieza’s spent more than a decade in hell after his death. Now, with the help of his loyal henchman, he’s been wished back to life by the power of the Dragon Balls. With a new form and the support of a 1,000 soldier army, Frieza’s stronger than ever—and he won’t rest until he destroys Goku! 

GokuGoku, the hero of Dragon Ball Z, is the most powerful warrior on earth! But that title might just be rivaled with the return of Frieza, the ultimate villain. Frieza’s power level is infinitely higher than it was when they last faced off. Can Goku finally put the unkillable villain to rest? 

VegetaVegeta is the powerful Saiyan Prince from Planet Vegeta. Once a brutal, evil warrior, he has come to obtain a righteous heart through his battles with Goku. Vegeta trains day-and-night in an effort to become more powerful than his Saiyan ally. Now that the overlord who destroyed his home planet has returned, can Vegeta put his rivalry with Goku aside to help protect planet Earth?

results.description:
Dear Doers,


Many of you have mentioned to me that you would like to learn more about the interplay between intellectual property and 3d printing.  So, by popular demand, I have arranged for a world-renowned expert on the subject to visit our group next week -- me.  And it is my pleasure to offer the presentation I give at conferences around the globe:  “Tea, Earl Grey, Hot:  3D Printing and the Future of Intellectual Property.”


Therefore, let’s Meetup on Tuesday, August 4th from 7-9pm (location to be determined).  It’s $20 as usual, but this time you must register and pay in advance in order for me to secure the venue.  Please register for this event no later than Friday, July 31.


Looking forward to seeing you next week!  Charlene


P.S. And, in case you don’t know by now, here is some information about your organizer and our guest speaker:


Charlene Flick is an experienced attorney and recognized expert in the areas of global intellectual property, technology, and media law and policy. Recently, Ms. Flick founded "Transcend 3D," a strategy consulting firm that assists businesses across markets mitigate risks and leverage opportunities associated with 3D Printing content and technologies. The firm prides itself on “thinking on a different plane” and aspires to serve as a long-term trusted advisor to enterprises small and large across sectors and borders. 


Ms. Flick is also the founder of New York City's “3D Printing Entrepreneurs Meetup,” which supports tomorrow’s 3D Printing founders and New York City’s evolving 3DP ecosystem. Additionally, she is a frequent speaker at conferences and investor roundtables around the world on this exciting emerging topic. 


Previously, Ms. Flick was the Director of Intellectual Property and Competition at the US Council for International Business (USCIB), where she directed the intellectual property and competition committees on behalf of the association and created the Amicus Brief Network, developing litigation strategy as to interventions before domestic and international tribunals. 


During President Clinton's Administration, Ms. Flick served as the Special Advisor for Intellectual Property at the U.S. Department of State and the Special Assistant to the Under Secretary for Global Affairs. She began her career as an attorney in the General Counsel's Office of the U.S. Federal Trade Commission, practicing antitrust, advertising regulation, and appellate litigation. 


For over twenty years, Charlene has carefully crafted a career at the crossroads of content and technology globally. Transcend 3D represents her latest manifestation of this passion for convergence.
results.name: "Tea, Earl Grey, Hot:  3D Printing and the Future of IP" -August 4 at 7pm

results.description:
Our Tuesday night Central Park training workouts are typically tempo runs or hill repeats.  These workouts are usually very well attended with a wide variety of paces.

The meeting spot is at the 72nd street transverse by Bethesda Fountain. There we'll give the full workout details, including distance, pacing groups, expected run time, and where we plan on meeting at the end. You can expect a typical workout to be between 5 and 8 miles (or less during hill workouts).

If it's your first time meeting us, feel free to come a few minutes early with any questions.  There are many other groups who meet on 72nd St so look for the one with folks in Whippet singlets.

Please note that there is no place to store bags inside Central Park. Pack light, or store your bags at a nearby gym if you are a member. Another option is the New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center, which stays open until 9pm: http://www.therunningcompany.net/new-yorks-homepage

When you RSVP, please post your pace time and/or training run distance for the day.

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
This meetup is held the first Tuesday of each month and has two purposes.

First, it serves as a general networking opportunity for Permies in the area to meet each other and to provide mutual aid. What are you working on and where? Second, this is an information session to increase knowledge about the numerous ways that permaculture can be applied in the world, from gardening/farming practices and land stewardship, to regenerative economic systems, community building, and nature connection.

*A $5 donation will be optional for our meetups. Proceeds help sponsor PDC students and other sustainable culture educational projects in the Northeast. The PayPal link sends a donation to Green Phoenix Permaculture, a 501c3 organization.*

Tim Spann:

I have been a programmer since I was a young child in the Gifted and Talented Program. I started programming on Commodore PETs – 4 bit. And then Apple IIs, Commodore 64s and some others. Basic, then Pascal, Fortran, C, C++, Java, JavaScript and more. I am currently a Senior Software Engineer at SecurityScorecard; before that I was a Senior Field Engineer for Pivotal.
