results.description:
Are you trying to break into the tech field? Curious about what its like to work in different technical positions? Looking to hire members for your team? Join us for the GDI Careers speaker series “A Day in the Life” and learn more about important pieces of a tech team. Hear from a panel of ladies from different companies and at different points in their career about how they came to be a professional in the tech industry, what their day-to-day responsibilities are like, and what advice they have for folks looking to enter the field.

Schedule for the evening:

7:00 - 7:15 Snacks and GDI Intro

7:15 - 8:00 Panelist Perspectives

8:00 - 8:30 Moderated and Open Q&A

8:30 - 9:00 Networking

Employers and recruiters are welcome to attend and bring marketing materials to share with attendees following the panel! Please note that you will be attending when you RSVP so that you can be announced.

A $10 donation toward the Girl Develop It scholarship fund is requested to confirm your attendance. 

Learn more about the panelists: 

Dahlia Bock is an engineer at SoundCloud. Even though she only got her first computer at the age of 18, she has been very fortunate to be able to have spent the last decade working across different platforms, languages, stacks and business domains. She is a stickler for testable code and enjoys influencing others with the same obsession. Dahlia lives with her wife and pet plants, Gertrude and Stan, in Brooklyn, NY.


Ashi Krishnan's first program was an infinite loop printing “I love you mom”. She came to New York from San Francisco in 2014 and immediately fell in love with the city – she still hasn’t left. Ashi has worked at NOAA and Google, developing weather forecasting tools, interactive projection art and highly scalable systems which deliver your emails to the NSA. Ashi loves both teaching and learning and is currently teaching at Dev Bootcamp NYC. 


Aurelia Moser is a librarian and developer in NYC. In addition leading NYC's GDI chapter, she teaches metadata and data visualization courses, and develops open source mapping software and data-journo curriculum at CartoDB. In her free time, she contributes to art && code community programs and participates in piles of hackathons for open data and open source programs. Full-stack from data munging to code monkeying, she's happy to geek for social good where possible. Check out the topic of her upcoming talk at OSCON: Visualizing flux: Time travel, torque, and temporal maps

Corey Nilan worked as a speech-language pathologist until she discovered programming and the world of web development, and she never looked back. She loves Ruby and Rails, but JavaScript is making in-roads into her heart. Corey is a web developer for Course Report, helping people find coding bootcamps, and for Nooklyn, helping people find apartments. She also teaches with Girl Develop It and coaches at Dev Bootcamp and loves being able to help other students with their own coding journey.

Mai Nguyen is a junior web developer at Fuzz Productions. Mai started dabbling in web development when Yahoo! GeoCities was still around. One of her first websites was a Hello Kitty fan site with way too many marquee tags. Mai enjoys helping other people find their passion in technology. She occasionally writes posts for people who are interested in taking the bootcamp route.
results.name: GDI NYC Careers | A Day in the Life | Developer & Technologist

results.description:
Thank you to everyone who came to our July Smutty Book Club!  I have been up to my eye balls in house guests and will send the post book club email soon.  This Saturday some of our book club members are going to Hunkomania. And August 11th we're putting together a bowling team for Pit Bowl a fundraiser for Animal Care in Control

The August Smutty Book is Afterburn by Zane! Yes, we are finally getting a little color into our books. And yes, finally a book with grown-ups, not the right out of college types. And Yes, finally a book with real characters, who have real friends, who can really get in the way.  I hope everyone likes Afterburn!


Here's what the publisher has to say:  


In the latest romantic romp from New York Times bestselling author Zane, two hapless lovers get lost in a dating game gone awry.

When Washington, D.C., chiropractor Yardley Brown goes to his local bank, it isn't only to make deposits into his account. He has long since accrued some interest in Rayne Waters, a bank employee who's too beautiful to be true -- and too beautiful to be single. At least that's what Yardley believes, which is why he has never approached her.

Little does he know that Rayne is anything but taken. Not for want of trying, of course. But after barely surviving a dating disaster with her hairdresser's brother and then falling for a member of her church band who, it turns out, is celibate, she's on the verge of giving up. That is, until Yardley -- discouraged by his own slew of dead-end romances -- finally works up the courage to give her a try.

The true craziness, however, is just beginning, thanks to a cast of characters who seem bent on botching the young couple's relationship.

There's Rayne's erratic mother, who constantly boasts about being a "good whore"; Yardley's playboy buddies, always trolling for sex; and, worst of all, past lovers who make a habit of popping up and ruining things as only old flames (or previous mistakes) can. Weaving the carnal and the comical in true Zane fashion, Rayne and Yardley's struggle to find love in a world gone mad is a timeless talk about everything that can go wrong in the dating game -- and a few things that can go right.

PLEASE NOTE that we limit attendance to better insure that all get a chance to have their writing critiqued.  If our maximum for the week is reached, you have the option of being notified when someone changes their RSVP to no.  PLEASE DO NOT RSVP YES UNLESS YOU ARE AS SURE AS IS HUMANLY POSSIBLE THAT YOU WILL BE ABLE TO ATTEND AND CHANGE YOUR RSVP TO NO IMMEDIATELY if your situation does change, for the sake of those waiting for a spot.  


Join us for a weekly get together of sometimes frank and hopefully always constructive criticism of your literary work. There is no restriction on the type of genre and only a few rules:

1. Bring up to 6 double spaced typed pages of your work for reading. Additional copies would be helpful in order to allow others in the group to follow along.

2. The author is not allowed to speak while feedback is being provided.

3. The same piece should not be reread at a future workshop.

We will meet every Tuesday at 7 PM on the first floor of the Central Library, unless a meetup is not scheduled for that date due to a holiday or other event. A floor plan link is available at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/sites/default/files/files/pdf/central/floorplan.pdf.

More information about the Brooklyn Central Library, including available public transportation options, can be found at http://www.brooklynpubliclibrary.org/locations/central.

Hope to see all of you there.

 

Danny

Guys, we're a triathlon team made up of a whole lotta runners. Let's show the city what we've got!

The plan: meet at Hamilton Fish at 7 PM on Tuesday. Lock your bags and put your running shoes and shorts in the pool area. Swim for half an hour, hop out of the pool, throw on those running clothes as fast as possible (transition, baby!), then hit the streets for a 30 minute jog.

Speed is key! Don't wait for your friends for the jog portion. Just run, run, run. In the event of another lap swim cancellation, the RUN IS ON. We'll lock our bags at Hamilton Fish and jog from there.

We welcome all levels of interest and experience. Want to swim but not into the triathlon culture? No worries, we want you to be a part of the team too!


We usually follow practice with dinner and beer in the area. Always a last minute decision. Show up and make a recommendation!

Registration for the Hamilton Fish Pool is FREE! Sign up on the spot.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson covering soccer techniques for passing, receiving, dribbling, turning, and much more. 

Please bring your own ball. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.


Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
A Course in Miracles Healing Clinic at CRS
 Mon. & Tue. 7 – 7:50 pm, Thu. 11 am – 12 pm
Sun 1 – 2 pm (12 – 1 pm on 2nd Sun of the month)
Suggested donation $20. No one is turned away.

Bring any issue you are facing right now — physically, emotionally, mentally, and/or spiritually. With eyes closed (you will be seated and a healer will stand nearby; no touching is involved), a CRS healer, trained in A Course in Miracles and spiritual reading/healing, will observe you with his inner sight, free of any judgments, as your truly are, a perfect shining spirit. Together, will ask the Holy Spirit (or Inner Guide if you prefer) to bring us directly to whatever seed thought is causing your current issues and ask for guidance about how your spirit really wants to make use of your present situation for its growth and sharing of love. After about 10 minutes of meditation, we will share the inspirational guidance that we receive. 

Aside from sharing the message that we receive from the Holy Spirit, we don't talk during this meetup event. We share healing quietly and provide you with an opportunity to come to rest, reflect, and remember who you truly are, in a supportive, non-judgmental, meditative environment.

We'd like to offer you an opportunity to experience stillness of mind and peace so that you can return to harmony with your true nature and purpose. Then you will find that rather than needing "solutions" to "problems" you will realize that you have no problems except those that you project.

We call this spiritual healing but it is not religious nor connected with any church or group. It is simply a practice of meditating together on our true nature and connecting with universal spirit/energy or what you will.

A Note About the Role of Words in Healing: "Strictly speaking, words play no part at all in healing. The motivating factor is prayer, or asking. What you ask for you receive. But this refers to the prayer of the heart, not to the words you use in praying. Sometimes the words and the prayer are contradictory; sometimes they agree. It does not matter. God does not understand words, for they were made by separated minds to keep them in the illusion of separation. Words can be helpful, particularly for the beginner, in helping concentration and facilitating the exclusion, or at least the control, of extraneous thoughts. Let us not forget, however, that words are but symbols of symbols. They are thus twice removed from reality...." — A Course in Miracles Manual for Teachers, Section 21

 

"Since only the mind can be sick, only the mind can be healed. Only the mind is in need of healing." —"PSYCHOTHERAPY: Purpose, Process and Practice,"Supplements to A Course in Miracles

results.description:
Check out our website:   www.NYCommunityChoir.com for  more information and to pre-pay for sessions and save money.

LOCATION
520 Eighth Avenue - 16th Floor


Join us weekly on Tuesdays for a soulful and uplifting musical experience that’s designed to include anyone who loves to sing – shower singers and professionals alike. 

Our sessions incorporate vocal technique training, choral singing, music-oriented meditation, community and relationship building activities, creative play, and musical improvisation and games all within a supportive, non-judgmental family environment. 

Music selections are soulful, spirit-driven Gospel, Broadway, Spiritual, World Music, chanting, Pop/Rock with lyrics that are universally accessible to people of any religious belief (no He, Him or Jesus). 

Each session is co-taught by industry seasoned professionals: Artistic Director, Amy Silverman, a wonderful accompanist Emily Imes, and, at most sessions, we also have a guest powerhouse musical director. We’re lucky to have many talented and in-demand musical directors and conductors who feel committed to our success and growth. 

Plan to be musically guided and inspired by the leadership of  Lesley Kernochan, Troy Burton, Chris Dilley and other fantastic surprise guest conductors.


===================================

WHAT TO EXPECT:

Choir Rehearsal + Jam Session + Singing Technique Training + Expressive Creative Activities + Amazing Family-like Supportive Community of People Who Love to Sing + Conscious, Spiritual and Soulful Approach + Professional, Dynamic Leaders


===================================

WHAT PARTICIPANTS HAVE SAID:

"Amy, words can't express (maybe I can sing it???) the amount of love and gratitude I have for you and everyone for participating last night. The experience was powerful, healing and joyful. I felt whole and complete in my voice in a way I've never felt before. I've always wanted to sing but haven't had the opportunity to really pursue. It's great the Universe has brought me this one that feels perfect. What a great combination of community building and sharing our hearts through song. I was very moved and can't wait to come back. Much love to you all!!" - Doug Larson

"It was an amazing experience, thank you very much for putting this all together. Ive been looking for a space like this, to express myself, for a long time and I cant believe I found it!!!! I'm looking forward to our next gathering. Thanks again!!!" - Vicky Vernier

===================================

REGISTRATION AND LOGISTICS

What does it cost?

$10 for first time guests (pay in person)


$25 pay in person
$22 pay in advance online

And discounted packages are available when you pay for 5, 10, 15 or all of the sessions in a group.

 


===================================


QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

Do I have to commit to coming all the time?
Nope - just come check us out - we hope you'll want to come consistently but there's room for everyone, even drop-ins!

Do I have to be a "singer"?
No - you just have to love to sing!

What do I need to bring?
Voice recorder or Smart Phone
Water Bottle
Open mind and heart
Desire to sing and connect playfully


I can't attend, how do I find out more about future opportunities?

 

Send an email to  [masked]  and say "please add me to your mailing list!"


I'm keeping everyone updated in the NY "I Love To Sing" Community Choir Group 
https://www.facebook.com/groups/529840427030696/?ref=ts&fref=ts

results.description:
In this lecture, screenwriter and professor Linda Cowgill with examine ways to incorporate emotion into your plot to strengthen characterization and the audience's response to your story. When writers think about plot we focus on action and conflict to define it. But many writers concentrate so much on the protagonist's active goal they neglect the emotional side of the story. As a result characterizations suffer. Drama is as much about reaction, the repercussions of action, as it is about action. Plot is more than just an outline of events, it's the ordering of emotions to build your characters and strengthen their relationships. Learn to define the emotional pattern of plots for screenplays and teleplays. Film & TV examples to be reviewed: Breaking Bad, Spiderman, American Beauty, Jaws

Linda Cowgill began her screenwriting career after completing her MFA at UCLA's School of Film and Television.  Linda has written television and films for Paramount, Universal, MGM, Warner Bros., and several small independents.  She has taught seminars and workshops at the American Film Institute, the Kennedy Center in Washington, D.C., the Boston Film Institute, Loyola Marymount University, IFP Miami and NALIP. She currently heads the Screenwriting Department at the Los Angeles Film School. Her books, Secrets of Screenplay Structure and Writing Short Films, are used at colleges and universities across the US, Canada and the UK. Recently, Writing Short Films has been translated into German, and Secrets of Screenplay Structure into Korean. Her experience mentoring screenwriters in the LA Film School's Feature Film Development Program led her to create The Art of Plotting.

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.

<a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/seminar-the-emotional-pattern-of-plot-with-linda-cowgill-tickets-17854025872"></a>
results.name: SEMINAR: The Emotional Pattern of Plot with Linda Cowgill

Guest Teacher

Carl Chimon Viggiani, Sensei

We are fortunate to have Carl Viggiani, Sensei visit with us.

Carl is a Dharma Heir of Robert Kennedy, SJ, Roshi.

Carl began formal study of Zen Buddhism with the Japanese Teacher Eido Roshi in 1987, later moving to Dai Bosatsu Zendo, Eido Roshi's monastery in the Catskills, where he lived and practiced until 1993. He continued with Daido Loori Roshi at Zen Mountain Monastery, and with Roshi Robert Kennedy at Morning Star Zendo in Jersey City.

results.description:
A modern masterpiece from one of Italy’s most acclaimed authors, My Brilliant Friend is a rich, intense, and generous-hearted story about two friends, Elena and Lila. 
The story begins in the 1950s, in a poor but vibrant neighborhood on the outskirts of Naples. Growing up on these tough streets the two girls learn to rely on each other ahead of anyone or anything else. As they grow, as their paths repeatedly diverge and converge, Elena and Lila remain best friends whose respective destinies are reflected and refracted in the other. They are likewise the embodiments of a nation undergoing momentous change.
results.name: My Brilliant Friend by Elena Ferrante

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie.  Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.
This revolutionary cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!

It would be great for you to RSVP if you plan on attending so others will know you will be there. Thanks and happy folding!

-Sok

NOTE: reminders emails for WTF will not be sent out because it will always be at the same time and same place and same day of the week and I am trying my best not to send out too many mass emails for the group! So check back here on the website for any changes and updates or cancellations ;)

We're excited to announce that our next feast will be held at Top Chef contestant Leah Cohen's Southeast Asian hotspot... Pig & Khao! This restaurant has been getting A TON of buzz including recognition as a 2 Star NY Times Critics' Pick and NY Mag Critics' Pick. We'll be taking over their private back patio in true summer fashion for this one. Chef Cohen has put together an awesome 6 Course Feast for us at a killer price (with optional unlimited beer pairing). Check out the full menu below.

There are 30 seats available for this feast so feel free to pass along to friends. Please note, you MUST rsvp via the link below to grab seats. We won't be able to accommodate guests who haven't rsvp'd via this link. 

RSVP at: https://tastingcollective.com/events/6

The price is $40 plus tax and gratuity (covers all of the food).

Looking forward to seeing you guys there!

-Nat

Chicharron

with ten spice and coconut vinegar

Green Papaya Salad

Sizzling Sisig

with pork head, chili, and whole egg

Khao Soi

with red curry, coconut milk, chicken, egg noodles, pickled mustard greens, and red onions

BBQ Baby Back Ribs

with P&K bbq sauce and Asian slaw

Ricotta Donuts

with kalamansi custard

Side of coconut rice

results.description:
Come on out and enjoy a night of food drink, conversation and a little friendly competition! Test your skills as New York Social Network Founder Dave Cervini hosts a fun evening that will have you thinking, laughing and learning about pop culture, music, TV, Movie, History, NYC and more.

Most questions are easy and others you may have to rely on your teammates for help. Come alone or with a friend. Even if you think you don’t know much trivia, it is still a great way to meet others in the group. We will have special sections set aside for NYSN members to meet and team up.  Pay as you go for food and drink. There are several rounds and prizes awarded for each round!

Can I come alone? Yes! If you do not know anyone there we will introduce you to others and make you part of teams.

What should I wear? Most come from work but The Firehouse is a pub with a very casual atmosphere.

Can I eat there? The Firehouse is known for it's wings. But they also have burgers, quesadillas, veggie sandwiches, salads, pizza, burrito's and more. If you want to eat with the group, plan to get there around 7pm.

How long does it last? We have 3 rounds of 15 questions each.  The trivia usually lasts until about 9:30pm.  After that some stayb and socialize and other head home.

How do I get there? It is near the corner of west 85th and Columbus Avenue.  The B,C stop a block away at CPW and 86th and the #1 stops at B'way and 86th.

This event is being hosted by The New York Social Network  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM  and several of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule). If you have any questions regarding this or any of our events please contact Dave Cervini directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: Fun & Easy Rotating Team Trivia Night ~ Free Night!

results.description:
Here is a unique opportunity to join a healing group that meets regularly to support your needs using the amazing potential of Tapping.

There will NOT be a lot of discussion or socializing because we will be too busy Tapping on specific and general issues of our Emtional and Physical concerns using EFT and something called Tong Ren.

EFT is well known for eliminating the causes of emotional distress. Many people are also aware of using EFT for physical well being. Sometimes we need to look at the emotional aspects that may be behind the issues of concern, and sometimes we just tap directly on the symptoms and notice if we get relief just from that. Its very nice when this happens and it happens a lot.

Tong Ren is another form of healing using tapping but unlike EFT it doesnt involve any dialog to describe the issues of concern. We just tap on a surragate model (Tong Ren) as if we were doing acupunture on a real body with intention of healing and it works!!!!

We'll meet at Jain's home in Scarsdale every 2nd and 4th Tuesday evening and whoever is interested in joining us is welcome. The only stipulation is that whatever issue you bring to our attention you let us tap on it.
results.name: Tapping Meetup for Emotional and Physical Healing with EFT and Tong Ren

group.name: Emotional Freedom Discussion and Healing Group, White Plains

results.description:
This final review session will prep you for the upcoming certification dives.

At this pool session we will review the skills needed for the Open-Water Certification dive next weekend

You must attend this final review at the pool to get approval for the certification dives from your instructor. You will be wearing a 6/7mm wetsuit at the last pool session so that you can get used to wearing and working with it. Make arrangements well in advance of this session, to be fitted and pick it up at the shop prior to this session. [masked]r [masked]

Using Dive Computers: To help familiarize you with how Underwater Dive Computers work, use the following links: Introduction to Dive Computers. (There is a nominal fee) Using an Underwater computer is one of the safest ways to dive today. Computers are relatively inexpensive and very reliable. Putting the tools you need to complete a safe and fun dive right in your hand. Enroll and complete online course, when finished printout and bring us the results/certificate. "Introduction to Dive Computers Link"

Why Buy My Own Equipment? Diving more than most other sports requires reliable equipment and instruction on its proper use. Don’t listen to an inexperienced expert or be fooled by the online hype, you get the best gear right here, from the people you can trust.


EQUIPMENT: You are responsible for having all the gear you need to dive this weekend. Arrange equipment rentals with the shop.and pick up any rental equipment you will need. You will be wearing a thicker wetsuit, which you must try on to ensure proper fit. Purchasing Neoprene gloves is also highly recommended. Scuba Gear required for Certification Dives.

Additionally you will need

• SDI Logbook

• Planning Slate

• Gloves

RENTAL PACKAGE AVAILABLE ITEMS

• Wetsuit (6mm or 7mm)

• Hood

• Weights and weight belt

• BCD (Buoyancy Compensator Device)

• Regulator

• Dive Computer (Introduction to Dive Computers.

• SCUBA Cylinder

You should reserve your equipment in advance and pick it up before the weekend. You are responsible for transporting all the equipment needed to complete your certification dives.

Call us with any questions. [masked]
Print out a few copies of the dive planner to bring with you tonight. Basic OW planner

Complete packages, starting at $799 

• Regulator with Octopus

• BCD

• Analog Gauges

Six Months to Pay ZERO INTEREST *

*Subject to terms of credit agreement

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
GOOD NEWS EVERYONE!

We now have a space at the Brooklyn Pride Center too!

In addition to our socials at the LGBT Center in Manhattan, we will be running more of the classic Icebreaker/Discussion meetups at the Brooklyn Pride Center. 

If you are new to the city, recently out, just looking for friends, or whatever experiences brought you to us - we offer a safe space where we can mingle and talk about our experiences as an LGBT person in New York City.

We will have drinks and snacks available for everyone who attends.

$5 Donation. Bring friends!

NOTE: Location of the Brooklyn Pride Center is a little tricky at first. It is located in 4 Metrotech Center, otherwise known as the CHASE Building, and is on the ground floor in the same lobby as Subway. If you have any difficulty finding the place you can reach me at[masked]-6116.

See you then!
results.name: Meetup at Brooklyn Pride Center

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***


Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights from till 11 pm.

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:

1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff.

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.

4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:

• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.

• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!
results.name: Tuesday 8pm Tennis at Lincoln Park - Experienced 3.0+ Players Only

results.description:
Join us for our next FREE Dating and Relationship Teleseminar

"The Sexually Intelligent Single Adult"

with Guest Speaker Roy Biancalana, Relationship Coach and Author

WHEN: Tuesday, August 4th, 2015 from 8:30 PM to 9:45 PM (ET)
SPEAKER: Roy Biancalana, Relationship Coach and Author
WHO'S INVITED: This Teleseminar is Open to EVERYONE 
HOW MUCH: Complimentary! 
HOW TO RSVP: http://predatingteleseminar.eventbrite.com 

"The Sexually Intelligent Single Adult"
with Guest Speaker Roy Biancalana, Relationship Coach and Author

Most people are familiar with “IQ” (Intelligence Quotient) and some are familiar with “EQ” (Emotional Quotient). But very few are familiar with “SQ” (Sexual Quotient).

In this critically important tele-seminar, hosted by relationship expert and #1 best-selling author, Roy Biancalana, you will learn how to be smart and savvy with your sexual energy so that you can attract a meaningful, lasting relationship.

Some topics to be discussed include:

To do it or not to do it—when to get physical How to spot and avoid “players” How to communicate your sexual boundaries Why size really does matter How to be sexually attractive (hint: it’s different for men and women) How to handle your sexual energy when you don’t have a partner What it means to be “great in the sack”  PLUS All attendees will receive:

One free 30 Minute Exploratory Coaching Session Special discounts from on Roy's many programs And more! ABOUT OUR SPEAKER -

Roy Biancalana: is known as "The Intimacy Guru," and is a nationally recognized leader in the field of attraction, intimacy and conscious relationships. He appears regularly on Fox35 TV in Orlando, FL as their relationship expert and is the author of the book, "A Drink with Legs" sold worldwide.

Roy is a certified relationship coach, spiritual teacher and was a PGA Tour player. His passion is working with men and women who are committed to awakening to their true spiritual nature and experiencing the love life they most desire. He specializes in supporting single people in attracting the love of their lives and also helping those who are in committed partnerships experience a deeper level of intimacy. He has clients all over the world and coaches by phone, Skype or in person.

PAST TELESEMINAR REPLAYS AND BONUSES: Missed one of our past free Teleseminars? At the bottom of our current teleseminar information page is a list of all past seminars and links to the free recordings! http://www.pre-dating.com/teleseminar/

results.description:
Hey guys! Thanks for your interest in my group! I have been throwing this little life drawing party every week at a cozy bar in Brooklyn and am looking to find new people interested in what I am doing. I have amassed an amazing variety of experienced art models and burlesque performers who show up every Tuesday at 8:30 pm to pose. I put out crayons, colored pencils and paper but encourage everyone to bring their own drawing materials! Its a fantastic way to meet new people, a fun date night, or an enriching, non-boring night out with friends.

We are located at 462 Union Avenue, right across the street from Kellogg's Diner on Metropolitan. Just a few steps from the L train at Lorimer and G train Metropolitan station.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

No fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP 24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

Name of the school William J. O’Shea (100W): The school entrance is located on West 77th street between Columbus and Amsterdam avenues (pretty much in the middle of the block) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right), Please wait and someone will open the door for you.  the court is on the second floor. 

For questions: Use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
DK & the Joy Machine along with Michelle Fury Feuer and Tine Kindermann rock Arlene's Grocery! Come out for queer-core Americana and acoustic punk at this lower east side altar of rock.

All admissions get you a FREE copy of SHY ONE... the new album OR an Andro Grrrl T. Your choice!

RSVP here and bring your ticket stub up after the show to get your door prize!

Bring your friends peeps!! Tickets: $8
21+

Her first single, The Four Walls, can be heard here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=idXqY2yNzy8

About DK and the Joy Machine: DK & The Joy Machine is known for a sultry, expressive voice, well-crafted songs, and genre-blending, innovative work on mountain dulcimer. Whether plucking, strumming, bowing or “rocking out” on this trad instrument. DK’s music is at turns evocative, moving, playful, and fun, while always remaining genuine.

DK is a NYC born, urban mountain dulcimer performer and singer-songwriter who plays both traditional “lap” and “Nova Scotian” style on four and five string dulcimers, holding the electric dulcimer like a guitar.

A Mid-East Mountain Dulcimer champion, DK won first place on “The Joy Machine” in the Great Trails Dulcimer contest in her 20s. Already an accomplished songwriter and composer, she adopted Irish tunes for dulcimer, playing in trad sessions and traditional Americana with Hank Halfhead and the Rambling Turkeys while living in Dublin for eight years. During this time she earned her PHD in cultural studies, and worked as a freelance writer and union organizer, publishing in Sojourner, The Sun magazine, and Harvard Gay and Lesbian Review, among others.

After being on hiatus for some 15 years, she came back to perform with gusto in 2012, writing new, innovative material and further pushing the boundaries both musically and politically, with a strong slant towards advocacy of social justice and LGBTQ rights. DKis also an arts activist, curating THE SONGBIRD SERIES, creating visibility for women artists. She is based in New York. Her latest release “ Shy One” is available on CD Baby, iTunes and all other digital music streaming and purchasing sites.https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/shy-one/id1015645196https://www.facebook.com/events/129762000701143/
results.name: Appalachian Rock & Roll- queer core Americana

results.description:
Do you own your own business?  Even the most well run business can face disaster. Despite your hard work and successful management, the unexpected can occur. Whether a large corporation or a mom and pop operation, you can protect the money and time you've invested into your business by applying for business insurance.

To explain the details of Commercial General Liability insurance and the needs for one's specific business, we are fortunate to have as our upcoming speaker, Robert Blume of Chadler Solutions. Robert will be explaining why having the proper Commercial General Liability insurance in place is so important for every business.  Most importantly, he will also review what CGL does and does not cover, thereby pointing out why your business may need additional coverage for your needs. 


Business owners, managers, and salespeople learn about each other's business and we share referrals.  First time attending? Enjoy breakfast on us!


Now, more than ever, business people need to network to stay in business. BNI Crossroads provides a positive, supportive, and structured environment to share ideas, contacts, and business referrals.

To avoid conflict, BNI chapters are allowed to have only one professional per profession - which mean that each of our members represents a specific category of business, effectively locking out the competition. Check out to see if your profession is currently taken at the following link: http://www.bninewjersey.com/chapterdetails.php?chapterId=1636&t=db3907f9cf60c71add464fcce0eddcfde87cc619cfe76e34c4aa5cb439f60347&name=BNI%20BNI%20Crossroads

If you or  someone you know  are looking to increase your sales and your sales force, we have plenty of leads to give out.  Check us out on Aug 5th and enjoy  breakfast on us.

Email with questions or for more information.
results.name: BNI Crossroads Breakfast & Networking

results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured!


Featuring:

Will Plaehn is the co-founder and CTO of LastMile Retail, an early startup in New York that is bringing local product availability to consumers. LastMile integrates with retailers' inventory to create listings designed to reach consumers searching for specific products online.

Since launching LastMile in November 2014, Will has helped build and deploy an initial product for market validation with over 100 retail locations live.

Will is passionate about product-market fit and moving ideas forward to implementation. Before starting LastMile, he was a consultant at IBM where he worked on a variety of projects ranging from SAP to product and program management. Coming from Salt Lake City, UT, Will is a diehard skier and avid homebrewer. He holds degrees in Math and Computer Science from Colgate University.

Midtown Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

results.description:
Much time has passed fellow compatriots, but it is time again to celebrate and experience New York City's most famous ART MUSEUM, the Metropolitan!

Let's go exploring again and see all the things we saw then with new members, and refresh ourselves on the MMA's permanent collections, and see new exhibits that feature the greatest works of art from all the cultures of the world. 

Admission price is DONATION. Pay $1, $2, $5, $20 - give them whatever you can afford. It all goes to maintaining the collection and making sure staff get a good wage!

Exhibits we'll definitely check out:

Egyptian Art
Greek & Roman Art
Old Masters Paintings
The American Wing
Modern & Contemporary Art
Musical Instruments
Arms & Armor

Also as for the special new showcases this month they have:

China Through the Looking Glass

A showcase of how culture Orientalism and Westernism may not be so far apart. This exhibition attempts to propose a less politicized and more positivistic examination of Orientalism as a site of infinite and unbridled creativity. Through careful juxtapositions of Western fashions and Chinese costumes and decorative arts, it presents a rethinking of Orientalism as an appreciative cultural response by the West to its encounters with the East. 

Sargent: Portraits of Artists and Friends


John Singer Sargent was a popular painter of the late 18th century. In which he focused most of his most popular works on friends and colleagues. You can very well say that his main studies were of his friendships he had with others and wanting to depict them what they do best in their environment.

HOW TO FIND US:  Meet group in front of the BIG GIFT SHOP located in the MAIN LOBBY, close to the entrance to Egyptian Art wing between 12:00 and 12:30pm, & don't be late!  Wear something "MLP" if you're new, so we can spot you easily, as we will make sure to be easy to spot out of the crowd.

ADVISORY: PLEASE do not bring in any markers, bottles, liquids, blades of any sort, not even scissors. MMA requires that backpacks be carried in front of you, and large bags be checked, and the line is long, so we advise you to PACK LIGHTLY. Coat Check is Free, but: Please look at the museum coat check page before planning your trip - Certain items they flat out won't accept, such as suitcases. 

http://www.metmuseum.org/visit/plan-your-visit/visitor-tips-and-policies

If it might rain on the day of the meetup, bring an umbrella and a plastic bag to keep your wet umbrella in. Museum Galleries close at 5:15, so we'll end the tour in the same place where we began, at the gift shop!
results.how_to_find_us: Meet group in front of  the BIG gift shop in the Museum LOBBY between 12:00 and 12:30pm, & don't be late! Kar is not a patient pony ^_^ Wear something "MLP" if you're new, so we can spot you easily.
results.name: Metropolitan Museum of Art Field Trip #4!

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

results.description:
Join us as we welcome Nikon to Adorama for a two part seminar. Nikon Technical Representative Alex Podstawski will discuss Landscape & Travel Photos and Macro Photography.

Session 1: LANDSCAPE AND TRAVEL PHOTOS

This seminar will help you learn how to capture and preserve the memorable moments from your travels and your local surroundings. You will hear and see various techniques to make better use of your camera and improve your understanding of photography. 

We will cover various equipment including a variety of lenses, filters and speedlights. Through visual aids we will discuss composition. You will learn how to build beautiful memories. Conveying the beauty and emotion that made you stop and shoot.

Session 2: MACRO PHOTOGRAPY

Learn to see life close up with macro photography.  Sometimes the most interesting photo subjects can be found right in your back yard. Exploring the world of macro photography can be done with almost any equipment and a little bit of training.

This class will cover topics such as lenses, magnification ratios, wireless flash, and macro tips and techniques. Sign up now and get ready for a new view of the tiny photo subjects all around us.

Alex Podstawski has been working as a Nikon Technical Representative since early 2012. At age 13 he began shooting on his first camera, a Nikon FE and has been working with light and cameras ever since.  Working in the photo industry since age 16 and shooting weddings only two years later, Alex has gained experience uncommon for someone his age.  His specialties include infrared and ultraviolet photography, portrait, landscape, wedding, event, wireless flash, and auto racing, among others.  With years of experience working in photo labs and specialty stores, as well as a diverse professional career, Alex is eager share his knowledge and enthusiasm for photography at every opportunity.

To explore our Nikon line of products, click here.

This seminar will be two (2) different sessions of ninety (90) minutes each


Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.
results.name: SEMINAR: Nikon Presents: Landscape & Travel Photos and Macro Photography

results.description:
Salma Hayek will appear at the Film Society for an informal chat in the Amphitheater about her latest project, the animated feature Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet, on which she served as a producer and lent her voice. Based on the book of the title (which has sold over 100 million copies in 40 languages since its publication in 1923), the film, opening August 7, intersperses Gibran’s elegant poetry with stunning animated sequences by Tomm Moore (Song of the Sea), Nina Paley (Sita Sings the Blues), Bill Plympton (Guide Dog), and a host of other award-winning animators from around the world.

Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet is set in a Mediterranean seaside village where Kamila (Hayek) cleans house for the exiled artist and poet Mustafa (Liam Neeson), but the more difficult job is keeping her free-spirited young daughter, Almitra (Quvenzhané Wallis), out of trouble. The trio embark on a journey meant to end with Mustafa’s return home—but first they must evade the authorities who fear that Mustafa’s words will incite rebellion.

Hayek is well known for her work in front of the camera with roles in Dogma, Desperado, Once Upon a Time in Mexico, Savages, Wild Wild West, and Frida (which earned her an Oscar nomination) and small-screen appearances on 30 Rock and Ugly Betty. Hayek also works extensively behind the camera, where she has served as both director and producer (and as executive-producer of Ugly Betty). In 2003, Hayek produced and directed the Showtime film The Maldonado Miracle, for which she won a Daytime Emmy Award for Outstanding Directing in a Children/Youth/Family Special. Hayek will talk about her work both as an actress and a filmmaker.

Free tickets will be distributed at the Elinor Bunin Munroe Film Center box office (144 West 65th Street, between Broadway and Amsterdam) on a first-come, first-served basis starting one hour prior to the talks. Limit one ticket per person, subject to availability.
results.name: Free Talks: Salma Hayek (Kahlil Gibran’s The Prophet)

results.description:
What we're up to!

Turtle Back Zoo = Cool. Wednesdays = Zoovies Nights, also = Cool.

August 5th is Jurassic Park! 

"Zoo-vies will be shown at Turtle Back Zoo on the rooftop of the new parking deck. Participants are asked to bring their own lawn chairs. Admission is free and the deck will be open for seating at 7 p.m. - 8 p.m. The movies will be shown at dusk. Refreshments will be for sale OR you can bring your own. Rain will cancel the presentation." http://turtlebackzoo.com/events-calendar/


The Zoo is open until 8:30 p.m. on Wednesday nights, so if you aren't interested in the Treetop Adventure Course, you could visit the Zoo before Jurassic Park. Admission is $13 adults, $10 kids and seniors.

We're planning on doing the Treetop Adventure Course before the Zoovies, but you don't have to do both activities. You do need reservations for the course though. Adventure course peeps would need to pay for and make their own reservation ahead of time. There is  a 6 p.m. time slot and a 5 p.m. time slot. The later time seems more logical since some people may need time to arrive after work, but if everyone doing the adventure course can make the earlier time, we can plan to get drinks/dinner afterwards and before heading to Zoovies. (They say the course can take 1-1.5 hours.) Please comment on your preference and we'll select a time from there. Pricing: $27 adult course, $32 with zipline; Kids are $17 for the junior course and the zipline is separate at $12. (Adult req.: 4'6 min, max of 250 lb., must wear proper footwear, etc.)  http://turtlebackzoo.com/ropes-course/

Happy Hour at McLoone's Boathouse as a kick-off for some or in between the Treetop Course and Zoovies for others:

http://www.mcloonesboathouse.com/index.php

http://www.mcloonesboathouse.com/pdf/menus/happy-hour.pdf


The Plan!

Adventure course partakers will meet by 5:45 p.m. at the entrance to the course. The site says to park in the same lot for the Zoo and then follow signs to the Treetop Adventure Course path. YOU MUST GO TO THE ABOVE LINK AND RESERVE YOUR SPOT FOR THE 6 P.M. COURSE! (Also read the webpage for necessary info like wearing sneakers and what to do with bags.)

Some folks have expressed interest in meeting at McLoone's Boathouse (right next to the Zoo) for Happy Hour. If you plan on joining this part of the evening, PLEASE COMMENT WITH THE TIME YOU PLAN TO ARRIVE AND HOW OTHERS CAN IDENTIFY YOU. The Treetop crew (including the organizers) can't make it there until after 7 pm when we finish, so you'll be on your own to locate one another. Steve had mentioned arriving at 6 p.m. so that's a good starting point.

Zoovie watchers can either meetup at McLoone's for Happy Hour OR meet at the parking deck for 7:30 p.m. admission. I haven't seen the set-up so I will comment with a more exact location if possible when I see it. 

Mary had mentioned the possibility of going to the Zoo at 5 p.m. and meeting at the entrance. If you're interested, please comment!

Any questions call or text[masked] (Tears). See you on Wednesday!

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

How to get to Queens West Sportsfield.

Queens West Sportsfield is located at:

5th Street between 47th Avenue & 46th Road, Long Island City


From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

From Queensboro it's 3 minutes/3 stops on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson.

This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

results.description:
Join Chelsea Fertility of New York City on August 5th for an informative and educational IVF workshop!

The evening’s activities will include wine and light fare, a raffle for a FREE IVF cycle, and an in-depth question and answer session with two of the nation’s top fertility doctors – Dr. Gindoff and Dr. Hartog. Bring your partner and join us on August 5th at 6:00PM to learn about:

• When is IVF is recommended?

• How IVF works?

• Do I need an egg donor or surrogate?

• What are my chances for success with IVF?

• What is the cost of IVF?

All attendees will be entered in a raffle for a chance to win a FREE IVF cycle.

Space is limited, so click here to RSVP on our website today!

results.description:
Hello everyone. We are up to more fun and this time it will be at Columbus Circle.

Our meetup group (if you don't want to miss future events) is www.meetup.com/PDAers

We will meet up at McGee's Pub to grab a drink and talk about the event. Once we hit 7 pm we will walk to the southwest entrance to Central Park and try our hand at high fiving and hugging. New location for this event so will see how it goes. We could also walk up to Bethesda Fountain or even go down under to the subway. We do this event rain or shine. If the weather is bad we go underground like good New Yorkers do when the weather is gross. If you have not joined us before please check out the video below to see what we do. We hope to see you there.

More high fives and hugs! I encourage people to bring friends/family who would be open to doing this!

So the general idea of how the evening goes:

6pm - 7pm meet up, grab a drink and make any new signs (bring supplies if you have some to share, this is also dependent on space)

7pm - 9pm - We walk to Columbus Circle and hand out high fives/hugs/love!

Here's an awesome video of what we do.

http://newyorknatives.com/lets-meet-up-and-hug-and-high-five/

This event is co-hosted with the #1 New York Shyness & Social Anxiety Meet up grou. Check them out and join them here:

http://www.meetup.com/NYShynessandSA/

Meeting Location:

McGee's Pub is where the "How I met Your Mother" writers came up with the show. It's neat to visit even if it doesnt look anything like the bar on the show. If you need to text me if your lost please do so at[masked]-0315.

Hope to see you there,

Wade

results.description:
First Timers, READ details before you RSVP.  

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY


When: We usually climb between 6:00pm and 9:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers tries their best to be there around 6:00pm. We will pair off around 6:15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/ 
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a><a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/">

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late leave a comment on the website. If you can't find the group just ask at the front desk.  Food/drinks apres-climb if the group decides.

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them).This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day.Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;).
results.name: Midweek Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Ready to be a riveting influencer and a key player in your field? Join us at this exclusive evening event.

Every day, we are met with opportunities to influence others. Whether you are networking, having a sales conversation, on the phone or presenting vital information, it is essential to make an instant impact so you can establish the trust, relationship and credibility needed to get the YES, grow your business and be a person of influence.

At this exclusive evening seminar, you will..

• Uncover how to create a riveting message to grab more attention

• Understand how to connect emotionally to be memorable

• Know how to walk into a room and make an instant impact

• Learn how to us your speaking voice to draw people in and keep them listening

• Discover how to ignite your natural magnetism to read as compelling and confident

Unlock powerful body language to influence people into action
Understand how to capture hearts & leave a permanent impression

Plus, you will have the opportunity to relax and network with like-minded individuals and leaders.

Imagine how much easier it would be to make a greater impact and inspire people into action if you had unstoppable confidence to walk into every situation and be influential…

Tickets only $25.

Register at:
https://cindyashton.samcart.com/products/influence-equation-seminar-nyc
results.name: The Influence Equation: An Evening Seminar

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- JJ)

(Co-Leader- Eric)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: WEDNESDAY 6:00pm Soccer @ LIC (2x7v7 game) for PS2G

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:

There are two galleries nearbye, the show is presented in both so we will meetup first at the gallery on 557C West 23rd Street at 6pm.

And then after an hour n a half or so move onto to see the gallery on 529 West 20th Street.

Some of the artists behind the amazing work should be there as well to make it even more interesting, definately come on out if you can!

I will raise a glass from Germany....6 hours ahead.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


This may be the friendliest and most social After Work Happy Hour you will every experience! Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

-A delicious menu is available with discounts till 8pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

What to expect:[masked] people ages 20's - 40's

What to wear: Business casual/stylish

How do I get there? Grand Central and Penn Station are just a blocks away.

Why should I come?  To make new friends, meet people from other groups, learn about NYSN programs and events, find out about other things going on with similar groups, network for business, make a personal connection, check out a new place or just get out of the apartment

Do I need to RSVP? No, but it does help us to see how many to expect and send any special messages that may need to go out.

If you have any questions before you register please e-mail [masked] or call[masked]-2256.  We want to make sure that this party is exactly what you are looking for so that you'll come out again and again!

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.

Please bring $4 cash to the game. 

• RSVPs close by 4:00PM on the day of the game. 

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club programs or activities.

results.description:
We'll start with dinner at Hudson eats, a fabulous new food court in Brookfield Place (formerly the Winter Garden). Then we'll walk downtown along the Hudson River Promenade, one of the most beautiful spots in the city, especially in the evening. We'll tour Battery City Park then head uptown along the East River, where we'll visit the new South Street Seaport to see how it's shaping up. Then we'll walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, which offers stunning views at night. Finally, we'll catch the F or A train on the other side of the bridge  shortly.

DISTANCE: 3-4 miles.


ENDING TIME: About 9:45 PM. But you can leave earlier, of course. 

COST: HALF-PRICE SPECIAL!!! Only $1!!! (plus whatever you spend for dinner).

TRANSPORTATION: A, C trains to Chambers St. 2, 3 trains to Park Place. N, R trains to Cortland St. 4, 5 to Fulton St. For details, including walking directions, For details consult hopstop.com, tripplanner.mta.info, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. 

.

group.name: Hudson County Flippers and Funders Meetup

results.description:
WEBSITE : TWITTER : FACEBOOK

Every Wednesday we get our game on at Berg'n, but every FIRST Wednesday of the month we try to do few special things. Along with our usual board game buffet August 5th we also have some demos lined up for both Monikers and The Metagame.

Monikers is an homage to a classic party game with many names (Salad Bowl, Fish Bowl, Celebrities, Times Up!), but re-wrapped in a stylish, fun new package. Check out their website to learn more or download the free print-and-play option. It's also available for sale at Amazon.

http://www.monikersgame.com/

The Metagame is actually six games rolled into one. Don't let it blow your mind. They range from silly to strategic and intimate groups to large parties. All this in one sleek, attractive box. Check out their website for more info and their print-and-play version. You can also buy their game at either Amazon or iam8bit.

http://metaga.me/

For both games the creator(s) will be present to run some games and there will copies present to purchase.

We'll also be bringing extra games along with multiple copies of some classics thanks to Brooklyn Brainery!

brooklynbrainery.com

Just a quick reminder not bring in outside food and to patronize any bar that hosts us. Check out bergn.com if you want to check out their food and drink menu; they have a great selection.

HOW MUCH IS THIS EVENT?

There's no admission fee, but there is a two drink minimum* which you will be expected to honor.

* (or monetary equivalent in non-alcoholic purchases if you don't touch the stuff.)

WHAT TYPE OF GAMES ARE PLAYED?

All types. Real short bluffing games decorated with skulls and flowers. Cooperative games fighting horrible diseases. Classic euro games where you haggle over sheep and wheat. Whether you want to fight unspeakable horrors in Arkham or build railroads across America or rebuild your farm after the black plague (more fun than it sounds) you can probably find a game you would like.

Some games you might see are 7 Wonders, Settlers of Catan, Pandemic, Dominion, Dixit, Puerto Rico, Eldritch Horror, Ticket to Ride, Carcasonne among many others. You're also welcome to bring any game you want to play!

I DON'T KNOW THESE GAMES? IS IT COOL IF I COME?

We're very friendly and if you have no idea what the hell we're talking about just trust us when we say it's ton of fun. We'll have tons of games and we're very happy to show you the rules. Hang out, haves some drinks, and learn a new game.

Questions? Comments? Contact us at [masked]
