results.description:
Whether you're a casual movie fan or seasoned cinephile, this workshop is a fun opportunity to learn more about what goes into the craft of moviemaking.

Meet and greet at 5:30pm:  Arrive early for the meet and greet, when we break into small groups to explore instructor-provided movie discussion questions.

Workshop at 6pm:  During the lecture, we take a look under the cinematic hood and see how the motion picture engine runs by discussing how the following crafts are woven together to create the power of movies:

Screenwriting - Blueprint for a Movie 

Acting - Breathing Life into Characters 

Production Design - Sets, Costumes, Props 

Camera & Lighting - Directing Visual Stories 

Editing - Putting the Puzzle Together

We will be investigating the homespun murder story Fargo. Everyone should watch the preselected movie in advance.   During the workshop, the group watches various selected scenes from the chosen flick and we dissect and discuss each scene.

The Movie Appreciation Workshop is held in the screening room of the always fun Videology Bar and Cinema in Williamsburg, Brooklyn.  Drinking and eating during the workshop are encouraged.

Several trivia questions about the selected movie are asked throughout each workshop. The winner gets a FREE drink ticket!

Explore movies you love, learn terminology and gain insight into the creative filmmaking process.  Join other cinema enthusiasts for an entertaining and enlightening lecture/ conversation about the magic that is the movies!
results.how_to_find_us: L train to Bedford Avenue.  Walk South on Bedford eight short blocks.  VIDEOLOGY is located at the corner of South 1st Street & Bedford Avenue in Williamsburg, Brooklyn  (Also JMZ to Marcy Avenue works)
results.name: Movie Appreciation Workshop:  The Craft Behind Movie Magic in Fargo

Forget about crowded rooftops, long lines to get in and people with attitudes.  New York Social Network founder Dave Cervini personally welcomes members of NYSN and several Social Networking Meet Up Groups to The Lexington Lounge at The Cort Hotel in the heart of midtown this Wednesday to socialize, network and connect in a fun and friendly atmosphere.  The Lexington Lounge is an upscale lounge in the lobby of the Stylish Cort Hotel on 39th and Lex that features a 25 foot bar, a FREE pool table, plus plush ottomans and cozy banquette areas for you to sit back and socialize with all your new friends!

Stop in for a drink or stay a bit longer, you'll be sure to meet other fun and interesting people.  Come alone or bring a friend, either way you will be glad you did. This is a great event for new members to come out and find out what our group is all about plus mix and mingle with long time members and their friends.

The night will feature...

-Drink specials until 8pm

-Fun ice breakers games with prizes

-NYSN staff on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others at the event. -Music played at conversational levels

-FREE admission

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending come on their own. Our staff will be on hand to welcome you and introduce you to others in the group.

Toastmasters International is a world leader in communication and leadership development. MINY Toastmasters is proud to be one of the 14,650 clubs in 126 countries that make up Toastmasters International Global network of meeting locations.

MINY Toastmasters provide a supportive and positive learning experience in which members are empowered to develop their communication and leadership skills, resulting in greater self-confidence and personal growth. By regularly giving speeches, gaining feedback, leading teams and guiding others to achieve their goals in a supportive atmosphere, leaders emerge from the Toastmasters program. Our goal at MINY Toastmasters is to empower individuals to become more effective communicators and leaders.

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play. 
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
El Museo del Barrio and the Museum of the City of New York present the second edition of Uptown Bounce: Summer Nights @ 104 & Fifth, a FREE joint series featuring musical performances, gallery talks, art-making workshops, renowned DJs, festive summer drinks, local food vendors, and more.

AT EL MUSEO DEL BARRIO

Join us for a variety of events, including a guided tour of both Museum of the City of New York and El Museo del Barrio, an artist talk in the galleries featuring Rodriguez Calero in conversation with guest curator Alejandro Anreus on her work in Rodriguez Calero: Urban Martyrs and Latter Day Santos. In El Teatro, a special screening of Third World Newsreel’s El Pueblo Se Levanta (1971), which focuses on the community of East Harlem, capturing the compassion and militancy of the Young Lords as they implemented their own social programs will be featured. Ongoing assorted sidewalk chalk hijinks by FEEGZ and crew. El Café presents the musical stylings of DJ Turmix, a specialist in Boogaloo, a favorite musical genre of the Young Lords and their generation; and live video performance by Lionel Cruet.


AT CITY MUSEUM

Get down with Operator Emz and <a>DJ Misbehaviour</a> of Mobile Mondays! (and friend to the HarlemGo Meetup from First Friday events at Madiba Harlem) spinning hip-hop, funk, & soul vinyl 45s. Learn classic street dance moves from renowned dance teacher ‘Sala.’ Chalk art by Kady Perry.

<a>Our Meetup</a>


We'll meetup at El Museo first. After you check-in, please go to El Cafe, which is inside El Museo Del Barrio (1230 Fifth Avenue, between 104rd & 105th Streets) for a quick meet & greet over sangria at 6:00pm, then check out the happenings at El Museo & City Museum. 

Directions to El Museo Del Barrio:

El Museo is located on Fifth Avenue, between 104th & 105th Streets.

By Bus: Take the #1, #2, #3, or #4 bus lines to 104th Street & Madison Avenue (or Fifth Avenue if you are heading downtown).

By Train: Take #6 train to 103rd Street, walk 3 avenues west to Fifth Ave.

For those that are driving, there are several parking options in the area. If you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, feel free to call or text Daniel at [masked] for more information.


Thanks!

About El Museo Del Barrio

Founded in 1969, El Museo del Barrio is recognized as New York's leading Latino cultural institution. Primarily featuring Latin American and Caribbean art, El Museo also takes much pride in specializing in works from Puerto Rico and artists in the Puerto Rican community here in New York City. Since moving to it's current permanent location in 1977, El Museo provides artistic cultural diversity as a member of the famed Museum Mile in NYC.

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

results.description:
Topic

Some time ago, Stephen Forte gave a presentation on the M language and Quadrant tool at a NY .NET User Group meet up.  During the presentation Stephen mentioned, correctly, that one of the most important features of any well-designed application is the database behind it; however, taking the users' requirements and turning them into a proper 3rd normalized form didn't always capture the users' needs.  M and Quadrant were meant to help solve this problem, among many others, in revolutionary, not evolutionary ways, but somewhere along the line the train came off the tracks, and the promise of M and Quadrant vanished.

Stephen Bohlen presented at an Agile FireStarter and defined Agile as a method that aims to keep things in flux right up until the end.  It may seem counter-intuitive, but instead of trying to figure out all the requirements up-front, beginning development, and finally and inevitably having to start over because the user changed his/her mind, we can develop the application a little bit at a time, each time adding to and/or modifying what we had before, most likely using a code-first approach. 

That said, using NORMA (an Object Role Modeling tool) would prevent the project from being in flux, at all, and gets to where M and Quadrant were meant to be.  It does this because it eliminates the impedance mismatch between user and developer, requirement and code that exists when using a code-first approach or when turning requirements into database objects in isolation.  It allows the business user to create and fine-tune an abstract model to match their business needs exactly, using the English language, up-front.  That abstract model can be instantly shaped into UML models of tables in 3rd normalized form and can be instantly turned into DDL, which can be copied and pasted into a SQL based database system.  More importantly, that same abstract model defines exactly the shape of the classes needed by the application.  Whether you are a developer describing your code, a database developer describing the schema, or a business person describing your requirements, each of your descriptions of the requirement would be identical.

About the Speaker

Ashraf Kharrubi is an application developer in New York City with twenty years of experience developing applications in the investment banking, healthcare, and online publishing sectors.  Over the course of his career he has taught himself dBase, FoxPro, Visual Basic, and C#, attaining the Microsoft Certified Solution Developer (MCSD.NET) certification in C# in the process.  Currently, he specializes in PowerShell, SQL Server, C#, andVB.NET, he has begun to teach himself F#.  Ashraf is also a soccer fanatic, supporting Arsenal football club in the English Premier League.

results.name: Exploring Object Role Modeling In Domain-Driven Design

Mid-Week Intensive Session - Starting to Slide!

The Mid-Week intensive classes are evening classes which cost $10 a person for an hour and a half lesson with up to 15 skaters.

Starting to Slide Class!

This is an intensive hour and a half class for people who would like to the aggressive stopping technique called Sliding! Sliding is a very useful stylized form of dealing with high speeds.  We will be teaching the beginner steps of glove sliding and how to build up to stand-up sliding.  This is the perfect meetup for those who have gotten the basics of skating and would like to build more skills to deal with higher speeds.

We will be working on:

• Coleman Slide

• Hands-Back Heel-Side Slide


• Toe-Side Slides

• Layback Slides


• Tech-sliding, soft-wheel sliding and More!

We will be meeting at the West 72nd Street Entrance to Central Park, from 6-6:30pm and walking to our skating spot in the park to skate from 6:30-8pm.


Please remember to bring your helmet, your safety is your own responsibility, and $10 cash for your spot in the lesson.

results.description:
WHAT WE DO

Open space for artists & technologists to get hands-on with new technology. We supply a bunch of hardware and a chill environment so you can hack away.

Tweet: @hardwarehacklab at #ThoughtWorksNYC

Visit: hardwarehacklab.io

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0kxNCYpxcXM

We use creative coding environments like openFrameworks or Max/MSP to play with everything from webcams to Oculus Rift. People of all experience levels, from beginners to veterans are welcome here.

WARNING

This meetup has no particular structure. We don't have 'hack lab' projects. We work on whatever we, and you, bring in each week - which could be anything.

The schedule is loose, the feeling is social and non-judgemental. We are just curious and want to see your projects. So bring what you have and share!

ROSTER

Oculus, Kinect 1/2, Arduino, Leap, Glass, Depth video, Brain-Computer Interface, openFrameworks, SuperCollider, Max/MSP, vvvv, Processing.

DO YOU HAVE SPECIFIC NEEDS?

Some of these items are only available on request or particular occasions. Use the comments below and direct messages to find out if particular hardware or people with particular skills will be around that week.

If you can't confirm, still drop by and meet us. The lab is a great place to come and learn and meet people.
results.name: Hardware Hack Lab

results.description:
Fresh out of NYC Camp 2015 and full of energy! We have Ben Jeavons speaking about Drupal security, Jon Pugh about Terra (dev-ops + Drupal) and Forest Mars about his new Geolocate module.

Agenda: 

• 6:00 - Door opens, socializing
• 6:30 - Announcements 
• 6:45 - Introductions 
• 7:00 - Lightning talk: Two-factor Auth & Drupal by Ben Jeavons (coltrane)
• 7:10 - Lightning talk: Geolocate module by Forest Mars (Forest Mars)
• 7:20 - Main talk: Drupal Heists - Real security stories and practical mitigations by Ben Jeavons (coltrane)
• 7:50 - Main talk: Terra: Easy Drupal on Docker by Jonathan Pugh (Jon Pugh)
• 8:20 - Closing remarks 
• 8:35 - Head to Beer Authority!

Break Out Sessions:
Breakout sessions take place in a separate space and are more informal, covering any number of topics the group wants to discuss.

• 7:00 - New to Drupal? - Bring your questions and problems for expert help. 


Afterwards: 
Beer Authority
300 W 40th St 
New York, NY 10018 
https://goo.gl/maps/eg2KX

=================================

Main Talk 1:

Title: Drupal Heists - Real security stories and practical mitigations by Ben Jeavons (coltrane)


Slides https://github.com/bjeavons/drupal-heists


Description: Two years ago hackers made off with the emails and passwords or nearly a million people, stolen from the database of one of the most popular websites in the world. It's a story we unfortunately hear in the news all the time, but in this case it was our own online home, drupal.org. 

How do attackers break into sites? But more importantly as site builders, owners, and developers, what can we do to prevent it from happening? And since its so pervasive, how do we plan for dealing with the inevitable and recover from a break-in? 

Presented by, Ben Jeavons, a member of the Drupal security team and having dealt with several real break-ins, I'll detail how website break-ins can happen and what you can do proactively anderra  reactively to deal with it. Come along and hear some stories of Drupal heists in action.

Bio: Ben has been working with web technologies since 2001 and holds a degree in Computer Science from the University of Colorado at Boulder. As a contributor to the Drupal project since 2007, Ben maintains several security-related modules including Security Review and Two-Factor Authentication, is a member of the Drupal Security Team and co-authored the Drupal Security Report, an analysis of Drupal's security posture. Ben is currently a software engineer at Card.com and lives in Brooklyn, NY, he can be found on Twitter @benswords.

Main Talk 2:

Title: Terra: Easy Drupal on Docker by Jonathan Pugh (Jon Pugh) 

Description: WIth Terra you can launch and scale a Drupal site in seconds. Terra is a suite of tools for the designed to stand up web apps with Docker easily and quickly. It is designed to be as simple as possible for developers, while being powerful enough to use in production at scale. With Terra, all you need to care about is your site's code. Stop wasting time setting up environments, let Terra and Docker do all the work for you. Three real world scenarios of Terra include scalable production environments, QA automation and local development.

Bio: Jon Pugh is the Founder & CEO of ThinkDrop, an open source consulting firm. Jon has been Drupaling since 2004. Jon is passionate about dev-ops and is the creator of OpenDevShop, HubDrop, and Terra Ops. Jon lives in Brooklyn, NY, and can be found on Twitter @jonpugh.

Follow us on Twitter @DrupalNYC

results.description:
On August 5, Dr. Stephen Wendel, Head of Behavioral Science at Morningstar, will introduce you to the ideas of behavioral economics and offer practical techniques you can use in any products you're interested in or creating. 

In Stephen’s talk, you will:

• Learn about behavioral economics and its cousin, the psychology of judgment and decision-making 

• See how its lessons are already being applied in consumer products from the Jawbone UP to Clocky the rolling clock 

• Understand how habits fit in and when they can smooth the path to action 

• Find out how to identify the behavioral obstacles your users face and overcome them 

Stephen's talk will teach you how to help your users take action, using the best research out there on decision-making and how it's been applied in the real world. 

A huge thank you to Noom for hosting us!

About the speaker:

Stephen Wendel is currently the Head of Behavioral Science at Morningstar, where he leads a team of behavioral researchers and practitioners in applying behavioral lessons to the company's communications and products. He is the Co-Founder and President of the Action Design Network and author of the books Designing for Behavior Change and Improving Employee Benefits: Why Employees Fail to Use Their Benefits and How Behavioral Economics Can Help. Formerly, he was the Principal Scientist at HelloWallet, where he applied behavioral science to improve the company's products and their impact on employees' lives. 


Here’s the agenda for the evening: 

6:30 PM: Drinks, snacks, and socializing.

7:00: Introduction and presentation from Stephen. 

7:30: Q&A with the audience.

7:45: Community announcements. If you’re hiring, want to tell us about an awesome event coming up, or have anything else to tell the Action Design community, let everyone know!

8:00: More drinks, snacks, and socializing. 

See you there!
results.name: Behavioral Economics 101 for Product Design with Stephen Wendel

results.description:
Join us for an evening of intense usability testing with fellow startup companies. 

Think 'Speed Dating' for Product Feedback. Over the course of an hour and a half you'll meet with 5-6 other startups and take turns to give and get feedback on each other's ideas.

THE FORMAT: 

Bring your wireframes, sketches, or freshly-baked code - and arrive with one clear task you want the user to achieve.

For example, it could be navigating through your onboarding, posting an event, listing an item on your site, or taking and sharing a photo.

You'll then have 7 minutes to watch (and listen!) to another startup interact with your product, before the tables turn and you get to test their product out too.

results.description:
Want to know more about the first building in NYC to achieve both Passive House Institute certification and NYSERDA Net Zero capable rating? Join us for a tour with Paul Castrucci Architect, Further, Inc. and Aeon Solar. Explore this newly constructed three family ultra-efficient row house that brings together modern aesthetics, sustainable design and a 12 KW solar array predicted to generate enough renewable energy to meet or exceed each apartment’s annual energy demand. 

As seen at http://R-951.com, state of the art building envelope, high efficiency systems and Energy Star appliances were used throughout R-951, which has benefited from NYC’s Green Zoning Initiative and a NYSERDA New York Energy Star Certified Home Tier 3 grant. Its residents will benefit from a healthy, quiet comfortable all-electric home, private outdoor space, rainwater collection system, tax breaks, and much more.

This tour is supported by sustainable building proponents at GreenHomeNYC, the NY Passive House Meetup, Solar One and NYSERDA EDGE. More information, contacts, images and press release are at http://R-951.com. 

Please RSVP here. Questions? Email [masked].

results.description:
Lets ride over the Williamsburg Bridge and follow the East river going north , through Greenpoint, over the Pulaski Bridge into Long Island City, head down to the Pepsi Cola sign,  stop at LIC Bar (outdoor garden, live music, http://www.licbar.com/eventcalendar/evcal.html) for refreshment, then either back to Manhattan over the 59 street bridge or if we feel like it, ride up to Astoria Park and hang out before heading home. 

As agreed by the group, we will wait 15 minutes for late-comers. If you need to give me a message or get lost during the ride, my phone is 646-four 3 zero-2686.

This will be a slow, flat (except for the bridges) and uncomplicated ride, suitable for most anyone. That said, anyone who feels like going faster are free to do so, we will just agree on intermediate meeting points.

Hope to see many of you!

- Runar

results.description:
Healing (literally meaning to make whole[1]) is the process of the restoration of health to an unbalanced, diseased or damaged organism.

With physical damage or disease suffered by an organism, healing involves the repair of living tissue, organs and the biological system as a whole and resumption of normal functioning. It is the process by which the cells in the body regenerate and repair to reduce the size of a damaged or necrotic area and replace it with new living tissue. The replacement can happen in two ways: by regeneration in which the necrotic cells are replaced by new cells that form similar tissue as was originally there; or by repair in which injured tissue is replaced with scar tissue. Most organs will heal using a mixture of both mechanisms.

Healing with medicine can be enhanced by Spiritual healing.Spiritual healing involves healing of all five bodies and not just physical body. We heal not only the symptoms but also the cause of the Disease.

results.description:
NYC is collectively a series of smaller communities, each one attached to another. Discussing a "local" concern or problem... is a city-wide matter. Properly solving one... effects us as a whole. It all begins with the discussion...

Ever had an idea on how to solve a local problem, but didn't feel like you could articulate it? Or wanted to bounce some ideas about a local problem off some other people in the community?

Swing by the Civic Art Lab and we'll be doing group sketches + brainstorming sessions on specific local issues involving land use, urban topics, etc.

Short discussion, break into groups, work in a condensed couple of hours, and share your finding with local attendees. Work to be documented and good ideas shared to local influencers.

Beverages available to get the creative juices flowing.

See you all there!

This event is hosted by Andrew Haner, Daniel Horn, and Michael Mazzella.
results.name: Open Design Charrette: Local Problems, Local Solutions

venue.name: Union Square Park

results.description:
Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park (SW corner of the park at E. 14th St. & Union Square W.  Look for the "Veg Meetup" sign.)


Our meetup group has historically been a social group. (With the subtle activist mission of promoting veganism by showing people how much fun it can be.) In recent years we've done an occasional event that was directly an activist event, but these have been few and far between.

While we are, and will continue to be, mostly a social group, we'd like to step up the number of activist events we do.


This August 5th event will be outreach to the general public to promote and encourage a vegan diet & lifestyle. We will hand out literature in a welcoming manner so our audience will be open to seeing how great the benefits of veganism are.


We will meet at the designated location in Union Square at 6:30 pm (please arrive on time!). After a brief discussion on strategy and positioning of people, along with a few reminders for the group, we'll leaflet from 6:45 pm to 7:45 pm. Then our group will reassemble at the designated location and walk over to a nearby, all-vegan restaurant to have dinner, discuss our experiences and thoughts, and socialize.

We know that not everyone in our group is vegan, but on this day we will be promoting veganism. You are very welcome to join us even if you are not yet 100% vegan, but please understand that the literature we will hand out will promote a purely vegan lifestyle. Mostly on this day you will be handing out literature rather than talking to people, but if you do happen to speak with people, we are promoting a vegan diet and lifestyle.

Where to meet: We will be meeting at the extreme southwest corner of Union Square Park, where Union Square West meets East 14th Street. We'll meet on the actual park block, right on the corner. You will see us holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign. We will meet right at 6:30pm. You may want to plan on being there early in order to be on time. Don't be late! We will talk for 15 minutes and then disburse to various nearby locations in the park.


We believe that grass-roots activism is vital in advancing the ideal, practice, and potential normalization of veganism in our world. So let's come together and do this, and also have fun while doing it!


Thank You All

Saurabh Dalal and David Greene
results.how_to_find_us: How to find us: We will be meeting at the extreme southwest corner of Union Square Park, where Union Square West meets East 14th Street. We'll meet on the actual park block, right on the corner. You will see us holding a "VEG MEETUP" sign.
results.name: Promoting Veganism in NYC - Union Square Park

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 6:30 pm - 7:30 pm
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners (but all welcome)
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS:

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

You can find the chapter here:

The Kybalion

The Kybalion: Hermetic Philosophy is a 1908 book claiming to be the essence of the teachings of Hermes Trismegistus, published anonymously by a person or persons under the pseudonym of "the Three Initiates"

All are Welcome!

results.description:
D&D Encounters is a great event for new and seasoned players! Using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and being formatted for casual play through WotC Adventurers League, each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week.

We encourage new players who want to make custom characters to come to the store early (any time after 6:00PM) or attend one of our D&D Player Primers. Pre-generated characters will be available!

E-mail [masked] for current level characters should be.

Abolish an ancient evil threatening devastation in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Called by the Elder Elemental Eye to serve, four corrupt prophets have risen from the depths of anonymity to claim mighty weapons with direct links to the power of the elemental princes. Each of these prophets has assembled a cadre of cultists and creatures to serve them in the construction of four elemental temples of lethal design. It is up to adventurers from heroic factions such as the Emerald Enclave and the Order of the Gauntlet to discover where the true power of each prophet lay, and dismantle it before it comes boiling up to obliterate the Realms.

CONEY ISLAND BEACH YOGA by donation (suggested donation $10)

WEDNESDAYS IN AUGUST, weather permitting
7:00-8:00 pm 

Come join me as we practice yoga to the sound of the waves! We will practice on the beach in Coney Island off West 19th Street.  This is an open-level yoga class, designed to accommodate beginners to more advanced practitioners.

Please plan on meeting at 6:45 pm at Lola Star Shop in the Stillwell Av subway station.  (When you're exiting from the turnstiles, take the Surf Av exit. Walk through the corridor lined with shops.  Lola Star is the last shop on your left before you get to the street called Surf Av. The shop is across from the Dunkin Donuts. **We do NOT meet at the Lola Star Shop on the boardwalk.) They have a limited amount of yoga mats that you can use for free. It is strongly suggested, however, that you bring your own mat. At 6:50, we will walk together to the beach.  If you are later than 6:50, come find us right on the beach by walking along the boardwalk to West 19th St. (When you get on the boardwalk, turn right towards the baseball stadium and Parachute jump, in the opposite direction of the Aquarium. We will be somewhere on the sand near the water, off the boardwalk, across from the Abe Stark Sports Center.). If you cannot find us, call me up to 7 pm:[masked]-5757.

SUBWAYS: D, Q, F, N trains to Coney Island

For more info, contact the instructor, Chia-Ti, at [masked] or Lola Surf Shop (www.lolastar.com)

About Donation-based classes: Donation classes are an affordable option to practice yoga. They are not free classes. The suggested donation for this Coney Island class is $10.  Of course, pay what you can.  Your generosity is appreciated to help sustain community classes.  

About Chia-Ti: I am a yoga teacher and Thai bodyworker. I have been teaching yoga for over 13 years. This is my third year teaching this donation-based yoga class in Coney Island. I love that we get to watch the sunset after class, and to teach on the beach in my borough! I teach yoga to adults, elders, and incarcerated teens. I believe yoga is a privilege that should be accessible and affordable to all who wish to practice. For more information about the services I offer, please visit my website: www.onelovewellness.com

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, August 5th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The August session of Cuban Salsa begins on Wednesday, 8/5!

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 1
This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner safety in an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 classes: ONLY $60 - That's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.


*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video links of our group doing Rueda de Casino:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class on Wednesdays at 8:30pm, immediately following the beginner class.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (starting August 4th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:


Adelante Studios
25 W31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

results.description:
This is a weekly improv class appropriate for all levels (including beginners) taught every Wednesday from 7-9pm.  The focus will be on scenework, rather than games.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 


-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

Each class is $10, and the fee is used to help cover the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  The class will be capped at 12 students to make sure that you have sufficient time to be on your feet.  Guaranteed satisfaction or your money back.  

Hope to see you there,

Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater.  He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Israel continues to battle a global branding dilemma despite the determined efforts of Israel advocacy organizations and government initiatives. The negative perception of Israel among politically minded people and the general apathy of a large portion of the populace, making them a prime target demographic, means both that a positive Israel perception must and can be created. At the core of changing perceptions is the ability to communicate relevant and appealing messages to targeted audiences throughout the world. We will discuss the content of these messages, the means and style of their communication and the correct demographics to receive them.

After years of growing anti-Israel advocacy, how can we as a community reverse this trend?

results.description:
WHY POUND?


POUND is a full-body cardio jam session, combining light resistance with constant simulated drumming. The workout fuses cardio, Pilates, isometric movements, plyometrics and Isometric poses into a 45-minute series. Burn between 400 and 900+ calories per hour, strengthen and sculpt infrequently used muscles, and drum your way to a leaner, slimmer physique – all while rocking out to your favorite music!

Through continual upper body motion using our lightly weighted drumsticks, called Ripstix™, you'll turn into a calorie-torching drummer, POUNDing off pounds as each song flies by. Rock, rap, dubstep, pop and old school music fuse to create the POUNDtrack series, which is hand-selected by music enthusiasts, drummers and POUND founders Kirsten Potenza and Cristina Peerenboom.

GET RIPPED WITH RIPSTIX™


What would a drumming workout be without drumsticks? We’ve invented unique, lightly weighted exercise drumsticks that have been specially designed to get you ripped — hence the name: Ripstix™!

Twice the weight of a standard drumstick (¼ lb each) and slightly shorter in length, Ripstix are designed to maximize your workout by alter the physics of your arm movement to burn more calories.

IT WORKS.


POUND combines easy to follow (and not complex or embarrassing) cardio moves with strength training and drumming. This combo works the entire body, raises the heart rate to a fat-burning zone, and forces each move to be as precise as a basic beat.

Each 2-4 minute song is carefully calibrated with interval peaks and extended fat burning sequences, providing you with the best workout in the shortest span of time. After you’re done rocking out to the 45-minute POUNDtrack, you’ll have done 15,000 reps, performed over 30 extended interval peaks, and zipped through over 70 techniques without even realizing it.

results.description:
This is a last-minute addition to the schedule, but it's a good one. Irish singer-songwriter/author Sean McCabe is back in town to sing some old and new songs and read from his latest works. So we'll join him on this night at Fraunces Tavern's Bourbon Lounge.


The historic Fraunces Tavern, which dates to colonial times, has been reinvigorated under the management of Ireland's Porterhouse Brewing Co. and has emerged as one of the top Irish music venues in New York.


There was a time not long ago when Sean McCabe WAS Irish pub music in New York. The one-time subway busker was a founding member of The Prodigals but was best known as lead singer of his own band, The McCabes, which drew packed houses at Paddy Reilly's every week in the late '90s and early 2000s. Sean has since settled into life as a solo artist and author and currently resides in Sweden. One of his books, "The Pubs of New York" is a fictional account, loosely based on his early adventures in the New York Irish pub rock scene. He'll be reading from his latest works, the novel "Breakfast in Woodside" and the book of poems, "Lyrics 'n Ballads". as well as playing some of his old McCabes classics and newer solo material.

Should be a great night and we'll have the Bourbon Lounge to ourselves for this event. Meet up starting at 7 for drinks, food and conversation and to get a seat. Sean should start around 8. I'll be inviting the other meetup groups I organize for including Old New York Bars, New York Celtic Music and Irish in New York. Sign up here or elsewhere, we'll figure it out. No cover charge!


See you there!
results.name: An Evening with Sean McCabe at Fraunces Tavern's Bourbon Lounge

group.name: The New York Irish Pub Challenge Meetup

results.description:
We'll meet on the 3rd floor.

Bring your laptops!

There's some magic we've been missing. It's seemed a little elusive in the back room of our collective consciousness. We've all been encouraged to contribute to our community, but we may have felt like we lacked the time or the confidence to be of assistance. However, the happy truth is that we can all do something useful somewhere. Tonight we'd like to offer you the opportunity to find out where, to show you how and to help you make this happen for real. Your mission, if you chose to accept it, is that you show up ready to have some fun.


The Magic Sauce of the Tech Community is our Open Source. And by the end of this evening, our first OPEN SOURCE LAB, we'll each have contributed in a meaningful, practical way to the community that helped us solve that eight-hour block during project week, or that inspired us to build something more creatively or efficiently in our own work. We'll use our three hours tonight to make... stuff... better.

Leading us in our discovery is Brandon Hilkert, Engineering Team Lead at PipelineDeals.

In his spare time, Brandon is a dedicated open source contributor, a blogger and the author of BUILD A RUBY GEM, a new book based on his successful 10-week email course. His newsletter goes out to more than 3000 subscribers twice a month, providing them with the kind of content that they can implement directly in their own applications. You can check out a preview of his screencast, below.

https://youtu.be/Ec_aX21Byw4

For those of you looking for jobs, becoming a more fully integrated member of the community will look good on your resume, sure, but for everyone involved, the secret ingredient in the magic sauce is the one that makes you feel good, too.  


Learn It. Do It. Share It.
results.name: The Magic Sauce Is Open Source.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

6-7 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
7:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
7:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
8:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going!

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: David Rubenstein Atrium, 62nd and Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Please, come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

results.description:
This is a last-minute addition to the schedule, but it's a good one. Irish singer-songwriter/author Sean McCabe is back in town to sing some old and new songs and read from his latest works. So we'll join him on this night at Fraunces Tavern's Bourbon Lounge.

The Fraunces Tavern is arguably the most historic bar in New York. A bar has been on this site since Samuel Fraunces opened the Queen's Head Tavern in 1762. The New York Chamber of Commerce was founded here in 1768, the Sons of Liberty planned the New York Tea Party here in 1774 and the New York Provincial Congress met here in 1776. The Colonial government's Department of Foreign Affairs, Department of Treasury and Department of War were all housed here in the late 18th century. And George Washington famously bade farewell to his officers in the tavern's Long Room at the end of the Revolutionary War in December 1783. All while the building was a tavern, which was where people met to learn the news of the day.

After the Federal Government relocated to Washington, the tavern became a boarding house, then a saloon. It's survived multiple fires, terrorist attacks and renovations and bears little resemblance to its early incarnation. Fraunces Tavern has recently been reinvigorated under the management of Ireland's Porterhouse Brewing Co. and has emerged as one of the top Irish music venues in New York.


And did I mention it's haunted?


There was a time not long ago when Sean McCabe WAS Irish pub music in New York. The one-time subway busker was a founding member of The Prodigals but was best known as lead singer of his own band, The McCabes, which drew packed houses at Paddy Reilly's every week in the late '90s and early 2000s. Sean has since settled into life as a solo artist and author and currently resides in Sweden. One of his books, "The Pubs of New York" is a fictional account, loosely based on his early adventures in the New York Irish pub rock scene. He'll be reading from his latest works, the novel "Breakfast in Woodside" and the book of poems, "Lyrics 'n Ballads". as well as playing some of his old McCabes classics and newer solo material. Should be a great night and we'll have the Bourbon Lounge to ourselves for this event. Meet up starting at 7 for drinks, food and conversation and to get a seat. Sean should start around 8.

I'll be inviting the other meetup groups I organize for including New York Irish Pub Challenge, New York Celtic Music and Irish in New York. Sign up here or elsewhere, we'll figure it out. No cover charge! See you there!
results.name: Bonus Meetup: Fraunces Tavern's Bourbon Lounge with Sean McCabe

results.description:
I am inviting you to watch one of the most important discussions about entrepreneurship I'll take part in this year. 

There is a shift of consciousness going on right now. A shift toward living in a more sustainable manner. As a result, how we conduct business is also changing. 

My friend Michael Hellerslien has taken on a leadership role in this movement. By organizing a speaker series consisting of 20 experts in this field, he has created something really valuable. The series is called, "Mindset of the Fearless Entrepreneur."

BTW: It's free! 

Get Access Here: http://goo.gl/xF37gz

If you're serious about upgrading how you approach business, this is for you. I feel honored to lend my voice to this movement. 

You'll get exclusive access to a panel of conscious entrepreneurs who cover topics such as: 

• How to be successful in the face of massive obstacles... by gifting yourself a clean slate to create possibilities from. 

• Why focusing on anything other than authentic expression will limit your ability to connect... and how that blunts the impact of your work. 

• Which practices expand your consciousness... enabling you to reach new levels of success. And much more... 

• Plus: Find out how to get access to over 20 of the world's most respected experts in this field for the price of... well, nothing. 

Access Mindset of the Fearless Entrepreneur interview series for free: http://goo.gl/xF37gz 

Big Bear Hugs,

Dana

P.S. Register now and you will get immediate access.  :)

TICKETS ON SALE FRIDAY JULY 24 AT 11AM!

QueensJS is going strong with our 1 YEAR ANNIVERSARY meeting on Wednesday, August 5th, at our usual haunt, Raven’s Head Pub in Astoria on 38th & Broadway, just around the corner from the Steinway MR stop and 7 short streets over from the Broadway NQ stop.


Because this is our 1 year anniversary we plan on celebrating in ~*~sTyLe~*~ so you'll have to get your ticket quickly if you want to find out what that means! (No clowns, we promise)

Your evening edutainment includes:

• Sergey Semashko (@sergesemashko) selected us to speak about "CSS Regression Testing"


• Lewaa Bahmad (@lewaabahmad)'s talk gets longer and longer about "SNAK3 - The Importance of Project-Based Learning"


• Tracy Hinds (@hackygolucky) gets edgy "Exploring Recipe Search: A dash of sugar, just a smidgen of graph database"


QueensJS expects all speakers and attendees to follow the JSConf code of conduct.

RSVPs, due to limited seating, will cost $5. All proceeds go towards charities that work to increase code literacy among NYC youth. There are no refunds, but you are more than welcome to transfer tickets.

If you would like to sponsor or speak at one of our events, please email us at organizers at queensjs dot com!

results.description:
GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

ONE NIGHT ONLY! Come aboard the 4th annual JEWISH LOVE BOAT.  This party is for JEWISH SINGLES ONLY and we will have 300+ attending (just like we did last year)! 

Choose from Chinese, Israeli or deli style foods and dance the night away while sailing around Manhattan aboard the Harbor Lights yacht!

What to expect: 

* Full Kosher dinner (Chinese food, Israeli food, deli sandwiches & dessert) 

* DJ plays the best dance music from 80's 90's & today

* Yacht has three decks w/ enclosed & open areas + 2 cash bars

* Mix & mingle with 300+ Jewish singles (30s, 40s, 50s)

* A three hour cruise around Manhattan on a luxury yacht 

ALL FOR $60 (if you purchase tickets by August 4th @ 10pm) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

After Aug 4th, $70 online or at dock (if space permits) 

 • The boat will sail rain or shine!  The boat has 3 levels w/ both air conditioned, enclosed areas and an outside deck on the top level. 

• Check in begins at 6:45pm.  Boat will leave between 7-7:30pm and return at 10:30pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". 

•  We're expecting a sell out so get your tickets ASAP.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• RSVP’s here reflect only a portion of those attending.  We are partnering with the JSTF w/ 4,000+ members.  Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM
results.name: The 4th Annual "Jewish" Love Boat (Dinner, Dessert, DJ, Dancing, Yacht Cruise)

The historic Fraunces Tavern, which dates to colonial times, has been reinvigorated under the management of Ireland's Porterhouse Brewing Co. and has emerged as one of the top Irish music venues in New York.

There was a time not long ago when Sean McCabe WAS Irish pub music in New York. The one-time subway busker was a founding member of The Prodigals but was best known as lead singer of his own band, The McCabes, which drew packed houses at Paddy Reilly's every week in the late '90s and early 2000s. Sean has since settled into life as a solo artist and author and currently resides in Sweden. One of his books, "The Pubs of New York" is a fictional account, loosely based on his early adventures in the New York Irish pub rock scene. He'll be reading from his latest works, the novel "Breakfast in Woodside" and the book of poems, "Lyrics 'n Ballads". as well as playing some of his old McCabes classics and newer solo material. Should be a great night and we'll have the Bourbon Lounge to ourselves for this event. Meet up starting at 7 for drinks, food and conversation and to get a seat. Sean should start around 8.

You may remember Sean from some fun summer meetups we did at Hurley's and O'Brien's 5-6 years ago. Even solo, he always puts on a great show.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

A scavenger hunt and party rolled into one! Join us for this fun evening where you will get to meet awesome people, explore one of NYC's iconic landmarks and enjoy a great party with the friends you have already made on the Scavenger Hunt!   It is a fun and different way to spend a Wednesday.

How it works:  Join us for check in from 6:30-7pm at Lexington's Lounge in the Cort Hotel on 39th and Lexington.  Have a drink, socialize and unwind from the days work.  Upon check-in we’ll group people together into teams of 4 or 5.  One person in your group will need to have a camera or camera phone.  After we have everyone checked in you will have 75 minutes to find all the clues we have sent you out to find!

At the end of 75 minutes your team will come back to Lexington's for food, drink and fun conversations about what you just experienced. We will tally up the scores and announce the winners.

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Cost: $10  Please bring exact change

Level: No prior knowledge needed of anything… just have fun.

Can I come alone?  Yes most attending will have signed up on their own.

What to wear: Anything (but you may find yourself running)

What to bring: A charged phone or Android device (don’t worry if you don’t have one, we’ll group you into a team that does)

What’s included?
- A fun and crazy time playing
- Meeting new people
- Prizes

There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

During the month of August, in addition to mindfulness, we'll explore lovingkindness meditation. 

(Totally optional, and you do not have to read the book to participate in the meetings this month, but if you'd like to get a head start, check out Sharon Salzberg's book, Lovingkindness: The Revolutionary Art of Happiness. For more on lovingkindness practice, check out IDP'S Metta Month resources.)



Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to support the teachers, the Astoria Bookshop, and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!
results.how_to_find_us: The church is located at 23-35 Broadway, between Crescent St. and 23rd St. It is on the north side of Broadway, just past Trade Fair and Synergy Fitness. There is an awning over the front door. The church shares the space with Art House Astoria.
results.name: Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Come and join us for the next live stream event of The Product Mentor!  Sit back and listen or join with your own questions.

• Mentor: Dominic Gadoury, Director Product Management, ADP
• Topic: Why Every Product Manager Needs to Know Big Data

RSVP to attend AND THEN at the start of this event visit http://TheProductMentor.com/live to join in!

Thanks & see you there!

About The Product Mentor

The Product Mentor is a program designed to pair Product Mentors and Mentees from around the World, across all industries, from start-up to enterprise, guided by the fundamental goals…

Better Decisions. Better Products. Better Product People.

Each Session of the program runs for 6 months with paired individuals…

• Conducting regular 1-on-1 mentor-mentee chats
• Sharing experiences with the larger Product community
• Participating in live-streamed product management lessons and Q&A

Signup to be a Mentor Today!

Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, August 5th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The August session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (August 5th - 26th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (August 4th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios
25 W 31st Street between Broadway and 5th Avenue
2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.

*Can't find our room? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.
results.how_to_find_us: Take elevators to the 2nd Floor & make a left. We have the entire studio loft space, complete with brand new, clean rooms, hardwood floors, mirrors, 12’ ceiling, A/C, & sound system.

* THIS MEETUP EVENT IS FOR WOMEN ONLY

Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene with. 

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to happy hours, clubs, bars, parties and everything else as single women we don't want to hit "solo." 

Meet 10-20 other "single and fabulous" women (30-55) at our upscale speed networking event over drink specials. Our prediction is you'll gain some new girlfriends and leave with more numbers than any other singles event you've been to.

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

results.description:
What is a civic hacknight?

This is a weekly project night is for dreamers, technologists, designers, developers, data scientists, map makers, and activists who are working on "civic technology" projects. Consider this to be a study hall or office hours to improve yourself and the city.

This night is for those who want to: 

 * work on projects 
 * explore NYC BigApps problems 
 * start a new project, or find one to join 
 * get feedback from experts 
 * learn about tools for local empowerment, open data, and open government

Bring your laptop, power supply, ideas, projects, maps, data, and questions. Collectively, we will try to answer them.

 === Hacknight resources ===

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, watch Civic Hacking 101, Civic Hacking 102, and review our projects page.

* Working Groups - Developers' Corner, CityGram.NYC, City Record Online, & MTA Service Alerts 
* Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools 
* Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

 === Projects & presentations ===

We keep the “formal” part of the evening down to a minimum: announcements, meet your neighbor, etc. After, we will have a number of people present, specific projects, and have some skills share / education. 

Community Projects:


* What are YOU working on? Plug it into this event's comments section!

 === Special Guests ===

For this hacknight and along with your projects, we will feature New York City Council Speaker's Office, our NYC BigApps colleagues.

For the last three years, the New York City Council has been working on a new kind of municipal budgeting: Participatory Budgeting. Affectionately called “PB”, residents in a growing number of Council districts decided how to spend millions of dollars in taxpayer money on neighborhood projects, such as playground improvements and technology for public schools.

This year, the Council is bringing PB to NYC BigApps 2015 as a Civic Engagement Challenge Partner. On August 5th, representatives from the Office of Council Speaker Melissa Mark-Viverito will be attending BetaNYC’s hacknight to discuss their challenges and outline their user stories.

Join us at Civic Hall to work on your NYC BigApps projects or to hear more about the Participatory Budgeting process (from idea generation to neighborhood voting) and to find out what kinds of civic engagement solutions you can build to help amplify the voices of New Yorkers!

 === Event Partners === 

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

 === Note about the venue ===

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

Light snacks will be served, but not enough to constitute a meal. Please feel free to bring food.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the "coworking" space.
results.name: Civic Hacknight at Civic Hall with City Council Speaker's Office!

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank 
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.
