results.description:
** Not many improv classes are this affordable in the city. Beginners and experienced improvisors are all welcome! **


Ever wondered what it might feel like to go with your GUT and create a situation from NOTHING right on the spot? The feeling is extraordinary. From beginning to end, building a moment either that tells a story and engages the audience is a powerful achievement, indeed. And honing this skill will make you a better public speaker as well!

Work with professional comedian and improvisor, Dewey Chaffee, on the basic tools required to start improvising like a pro!

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production. 

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."

** Please RSVP online so that we can get an accurate headcount and not cancel by mistake. **
results.name: Public Speaking Through Basic Improv!

results.description:
Join us for an ongoing weekly game of the new version of Dungeons & Dragons! Take on the role of a heroic fantasy adventurer as you travel the Forgotten Realms trying to uncover a plot by the evil Queen of Dragons!

NO previous experience is required to play! We will teach rules and provide characters if needed. Play once or twice or join us every week for an ongoing adventure played out over several months like a great fantasy TV series starring YOU!

Ages 13 and up are welcome, 12 and under if a parent is present during the game (you don't need to play, but can if you want!).

Admission is by Modern Myths event pass (a Day Pass is $5 you get back in store credit, and Monthly and Yearly options are available). Space at the tables can be limited, so show up early to make sure you get a seat.

DUNGEON MASTERS NEEDED! If you have an interest in leading games at the store, contact us! You'll qualify for goodies from WotC, free passes to store events, and a small weekly store credit for every session you run!

Come aboard the 4th annual JEWISH LOVE BOAT.  This party is for JEWISH SINGLES ONLY and we will have 300+ attending (just like we did last year)!


Choose from Chinese, Israeli or deli style foods and dance the night away while sailing around Manhattan aboard the Harbor Lights yacht!

What to expect:

* Full Kosher dinner (Chinese food, Israeli food, deli sandwiches & dessert) 

* DJ plays the best dance music from 80's 90's & today

* Yacht has three decks w/ enclosed & open areas + 2 cash bars

* Mix & mingle with 300+ Jewish singles (30s, 40s, 50s)

* A three hour cruise around Manhattan on a luxury yacht

ALL FOR $60 (if you purchase tickets by August 4th @ 10pm) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

After Aug 4th, $70 online or at dock (if space permits) 


 • The boat will sail rain or shine!  The boat has 3 levels w/ both air conditioned, enclosed areas and an outside deck on the top level. 


• Check in begins at 6:45pm.  Boat will leave between 7-7:30pm and return at 10:30pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". 

•  We're expecting a sell out so get your tickets ASAP.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• RSVP’s here reflect only a portion of those attending.  We are partnering with the JSTF w/ 4,000+ members.  Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

results.description:
Join us on Wednesday, August 5th for the first in a new series of IGDA NYC roundtable events! This month’s session will be for all types of game devs using Unity, particularly in a team or studio setting.
Unity is fast becoming the tool of choice for teams large and small, from students to indies, and increasingly for studios creating larger commercial projects as well. But how does Unity scale? What are some of the issues and challenges faced by larger teams collaborating on projects? What pipeline and process issues have you encountered, and how have you worked around them? What do you love about Unity… and what do you wish you could change?
Featuring guests from local Unity studios including Muse Games, What Pumpkin Studios, Eppy Games, and more, this event will be a participatory, closed-door roundtable discussion among peers. Developers of all disciplines are welcome. Capacity will be strictly limited, and the event will not be recorded. Have a burning question, a brilliant solution, a sticky situation, or an issue you’ve been wrestling with? Come talk shop with other game devs, share knowledge, gain insight, or just vent to a sympathetic crowd.
Unity: it’s… great!

Event details and RSVP here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/igda-nyc-unity-developers-roundtable-tickets-17942139422
results.name: IGDA NYC is holding a Unity Roundtable

results.description:
We're actually sold out, 200 RSVPs... but we'll have another event shortly and you can join the waitlist using the Eventbrite link below.


As a collaborative project between the Michele Mariaud Gallery, Hospitalented's SKETCH Event Professionals Group and the Meeting & Event Planning class at LaGuardia Community College, we invite you to join us for an informational night to learn about seven places to put down on your bucket list. The event doubles as a networking event for those affiliated with the event planning industry. We invite companies/vendors who generally supply food, music or decor to join and promote themselves.

The class has selected seven destinations to highlight for our guests. These places have diverse culture, natural attractions, tasty food and are largely unknown or misunderstood by tourists. These destinations are not visited as often but they have lots to offer and fewer crowds. Come learn more about Nepal, Sri Lanka, Haiti, Solomon Islands, Malta, Faroe Islands, and Poland. Learn about their culture, get a taste of their food and enjoy music from these wonderful destinations to visit.

https://tasteof7cultures.eventbrite.com
results.name: Taste of Seven Cultures

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills!  This session is open to sketchers of all levels. 

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist. 

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the drawing class on the second floor.
results.name: Wednesday - Live Model Drawing - Union Square

These destinations are not visited as often but they have lots to offer and fewer crowds. Come learn more about Nepal, Sri Lanka, Haiti, Solomon Islands, Malta, Faroe Islands, and Poland. Learn about their culture, get a taste of their food and enjoy music from these wonderful destinations to visit.

https://tasteof7cultures.eventbrite.com
results.name: Taste of Seven Cultures

results.description:
Come support high schoolers who are learning how to give tech presentations! As part of their iMentor Internship, they've brainstormed ideas for new features for the iMentor platform (a non-profit that helps underprivileged students prepare and apply for college). They need practice making their case in front of a real live audience. That means you lovely humans!

Not only will you be supporting young geeks in training, you'll also get nice warm fuzzy feelings from doing something good for others. Bring your biggest supportive smile and thoughts of confetti. We'll provide the pizza.

* Males under the age of 18 participating in the iMentor internship program are welcomed at this event. Otherwise, our usual women-only rule applies. If you consider yourself to be a woman, we do too.

* No recruiters
results.name: Support the young geeks of the future!

results.description:
This event is for WOMEN ONLY. Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene with. 

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to happy hours, clubs, bars, parties and everything else as single women we don't want to hit "solo." 

Meet 10-20 other "single and fabulous" women (30-55) at our upscale speed networking event over drink specials. Our prediction is you'll gain some new girlfriends and leave with more numbers than any other event you've been to.

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

First 5 women to get tickets save $5 by using discount code "BFF" at checkout  ($20)  MUST PURCHASE TICKET IN ADVANCE HERE - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/

results.description:
GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

Come aboard the 4th annual JEWISH LOVE BOAT.  This party is for JEWISH SINGLES ONLY and we will have 300+ attending (just like we did last year)! 

Choose from Chinese, Israeli or deli style foods and dance the night away while sailing around Manhattan aboard the Harbor Lights yacht!

What to expect: 

* Full Kosher dinner (Chinese food, Israeli food, deli sandwiches & dessert) 

* DJ plays the best dance music from 80's 90's & today

* Yacht has three decks w/ enclosed & open areas + 2 cash bars

* Mix & mingle with 300+ Jewish singles (30s, 40s, 50s)

* A three hour cruise around Manhattan on a luxury yacht 

ALL FOR $60 (if you purchase tickets by August 4th @ 10pm) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM

After Aug 4th, $70 online or at dock (if space permits) 

 • The boat will sail rain or shine!  The boat has 3 levels w/ both air conditioned, enclosed areas and an outside deck on the top level. 

• Check in begins at 6:45pm.  Boat will leave between 7-7:30pm and return at 10:30pm.  Please arrive on time - if you arrive 10 minutes late, the boat will be gone!

• There is paid parking at the marina, or you can try to find parking on the street. To get street parking, please arrive early to look around.  By subway, take 6, N, Q, R lines to 23rd Street, walk 4 blocks east - the Marina will be in front of you.

• There is no strict dress code, but we recommend "neat casual". 

•  We're expecting a sell out so get your tickets ASAP.  Tickets are only refundable if cruise is cancelled.

• RSVP’s here reflect only a portion of those attending.  We are partnering with the JSTF w/ 4,000+ members.  Get tix here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/loveboat/dates/Aug-05-2015_at_0700PM
results.name: The 4th Annual "Jewish" Love Boat (Dinner, Dessert, DJ, Dancing, Yacht Cruise)

results.description:
It's time for the Breakneck Ridge afterwork summer series where we go hike up Breakneck Ridge, drink booze and watch the sunset.

We take the train after work from Grand Central and meet up everyone up at the Cold Spring Metro North train station. Once we are there we hitch a ride to Breakneck Ridge from the train station. We hike to the top, eat dinner and drink beer, wine or whatever is your preferred drink. I will meet those taking train from Grand Central at 5:20pm by the clock. We will then take the 5:32pm train from Grand Central which arrives at 6:46 in Cold Spring.

If you are driving please meet us at the train station so that you help us shuttle hikers to the trail.

What you should bring:

- A headlamp unless you have night vision.

- Trail runners or hiking boots.

- Food to eat at the top.

- Booze. (If you are driving or you don't drink you can still come this is optional.)

- A reusable cup.

The hike:

This is a short 2 mile hike at most. It's pretty easy if you are in good shape. It's very steep at the beginning but not too challenging. I qualify it as a beginner hike but only if you are in very good shape. We will take the 11:20pm train back to the city from Cold Spring.
results.how_to_find_us: We will take the train together
results.name: Breakneck Ridge Sunset Hike and Wine Summer Series

results.description: Join this general Bernie meeting and Voter Registration Training in the backyard at The 4th Ave Pub.  7pm-8:15PM will be the broader general meeting, where if you're new to the movement, you can meet other Bernie activists, and learn how to get more involved.  At 8:15 Rob and Dave will lead a voter registration training where you'll learn best practices for getting people registered and identifying anyone who needs to change their party affiliation to Democrat by October 9th.  Come with ideas and locations you'd like to canvas with others.  We'll end the meeting by forming groups with plans to go out and register people in the days, weeks, and months following.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in the backyard!
results.name: Voter Registration Training

results.description:
Anxiety has surpassed depression as the most prevalent cause of stress and anguish in our society today. Worrying about the future and strategizing about how to avoid perceived danger is tiring and confusing. So many of us live with fear and anxiety that keeps our minds buzzing and our bodies constricted and overcharged. In this class we'll connect with our capacity to generate kindness and explore the relationship between love, insight, and fearful contractions of the heart. Learn to deepen your practice of centering in the spirit of love! 

Visit http://tinyurl.com/llq77gk for details!

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation: Befriending Fear and Anxiety (Paid)

Some topics of discussion will be:

An informal Q&A session will follow the talk. 

We look forward to meeting you!

-The Fullstack Team

results.description:
If you are looking to turn your First Home Ownership experience into a Profitable one, this is an event you'll surely be glad you attended!

The list of topics we will cover are including but not limited to:

The Different sectors of Realty

How to make Your Credit work for You

Little-to-NO MONEY- Down Opportunities

The Current NYC Metro Area Market (Which areas are trending upward Vs. downward)

Pros & Cons of venturing into Realty

How Investment Realty can help your Start-Up or Small business to grow

The Basic Requirements to get involved 
& Much More!


Through our work we have found far too often that many people actually have great interest in the workings of the Realty Industry but begin to feel overwhelmed when attempting to gain knowledge. Unfortunately, either they get lost in the jargon of the business, don't feel they qualify or just have been fed a slew of misinformation. The reality is, depending on the sector of Realty one may want to enter, many of us walk around already qualified to get involved as-is and just don't know it!

Registration will be Absolutely FREE & Refreshments will be served. Don't worry, we also will NOT be springing options on you to pay for further use of our services or to work for our team at any time during the workshop either. This will be a commitment-free, informative session meant to raise awareness into the inner workings of investment realty and CIG. The workshop will be especially useful for young professionals looking to get into Realty for the first time but all are welcomed including Real Estate Investors on all levels.
results.name: Making Your 1st Home Owner Experience Profitable!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED (for both real grass and artificial grass)! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T.)

(Co-Leader- Eric C.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.

Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

Let us walk the path of Oneness!

Much Love and Gratitude,

Julie

We're looking forward to seeing everyone there!

Trevor NextGen NYC is a community of volunteers dedicated to supporting The Trevor Project’s mission to end suicide among LGBTQ youth by serving as an entry point for programmatic volunteers, spreading awareness about The Trevor Project’s services, supporting leadership development and advocacy for the LGBTQ community, encouraging lasting engagement with The Trevor Project by building fellowship and camaraderie amongst our diverse group of volunteers, and fundraising to provide financial support for The Trevor Project’s life-affirming resources.
results.name: Volunteer! Trevor NextGen August General Meeting

results.name: Joumor presents Productivity 101

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 10 pgs (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

venue.name: Central Park: NE corner of Columbus Circle by the big statue!

results.description:
Wednesday Runs in Central Park!

On hump day, we own the pavement. Going forward, we'll meet on Wednesdays at 7:30PM at the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll start with a brief stretch and share, and then we'll embark on either the 3-mile or 6-mile loop.

This running group is for everyone in the innovation/startup community, but we don't discriminate. We're open to all runners and professions. Please RSVP when you know you'll be able to meet.

After our runs we'll relax at a nice nearby pub to discuss how we're going to fix the world's problems.

Clarification on the meeting spot: We'll meet at the northeast corner of Columbus Circle. This is the same as the southwest corner of Central Park. We'll meet right next to the big statue that is next to the entrance to the park trail. Just be precise, we'll meet at the immediate west of said big statue.

See you soon!

Alex
results.how_to_find_us: SW corner of Central Park on the west side of the large stature (Not the Columbus Statue in the middle of the circle) Cross streets: NE corner of Central Park West and 59th St.
results.name: Wednesday Runs in Central Park

results.description:
This is a casual in-store wine tasting event, usually on the 1st Wednesday of every month, featuring a selection of 3 wines and light refreshments.

Join the Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club at The Artisan Collective for wine sipping and socializing in a fun and unpretentious environment.  Each month we will taste and discuss three new wines.  This event is a great way to develop your wine tasting skills, learn about different wines and meet other wine enthusiasts!

Upcoming Tasting Dates & Themes

• 7/1:  Drink Local (NY & NJ Wines)

• 8/5:  South African Wines

• 9/2 - Italian Wines Part I (Northern Italy)

• 10/7 - Italian Wines Part II (Southern Italy & Islands)

Admission: $10

Directions:  NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station or Broad Street Station.

From Newark Penn Station: Take the Light Rail to NJ PAC/Center Street and walk approximately 2 blocks West to the corner of Central & Halsey Street (cross Broad Street). Turn left onto Halsey and walk to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park.  Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street.  Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.
results.name: Wine Tasting Wednesdays

group.name: Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club - NJ/NY

results.description:
Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we meditate together by chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of the gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we begin our meeting at 5 pm followed by an informal potluck social. If you are planning on staying for the potluck, be sure to visit www.perfectpotluck.com to enter your food selection. The website will help you decide what food to contribute to the potluck to make sure we have a healthy, balanced meal.

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.   We never have only a few members at a meeting. A dozen or more usually attend each meeting. The special potluck meetings we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of two dozen people.

Call Merrill or Mataji anytime you have questions:[masked]-5334.

results.description:
Inner Guidance Discussion and Discovery Workshop

Can you hear the inner whisper of divine guidance speaking to you?  How do you begin using this inner guidance?  Inner guidance is our divine birthright, which we can all discover how to connect with. Come explore and learn how to strengthen your inner connection and listening skills so that you can fulfill your highest and greatest destiny in this life.

We invite you to this FREE open discussion and personal discovery process to explore the innate relationship each person has with spiritual guidance for insight, protection, and divine love.   Please join like-minded people to explore the many forms of inner guidance, applying it in your life, and the benefits of growing spiritually.  We look forward to seeing you for an enjoyable evening.

Wednesday, August 5th, 7:30 pm

ECKANKAR Center 
11 Park Street, Montclair, NJ 
There is on-street parking and two municipal parking lots in the area. Please pay particular attention to meters and parking signs. (Metered parking is free evenings after 7pm and on Sundays.)

For more information on this and other events being held throughout the state, visit our Eckankar in New Jersey site:  www.eckankar-nj.org

You're also welcome to see us on Facebook:  facebook.com/Eckankarnj

<a href="http://www.eckankar-nj.org"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Located north of Bloomfield Ave, right next to the municipal parking deck, next to the YMCA. Enter the glass door to the left of Villa Victoria Pizzeria and go upstairs to our room on the 2nd floor, directly across from the stairs.

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!

#throwbackSUMMER is FULL ON at BFunk Naach Xpress! If I were you, I would want a blast to the past every once in a while. This week's choreography is to the song 'Mauja hi Mauja'. Whoaaa... took you back right? No? what. WHY. No worries, we will change that when you come :)

What is Naach Xpress though? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it! Here's a sneak peek from a one of our classes:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J_SjOF-7b0k

Go follow us on Instagram as well (@bollywoodfunk)! Get updated on behind the scenes footage, updates, and tons of the BFunk family dose.

NAACH XPRESS runs WEDNESDAY from 8-9PM at Pearl Studios in NYC. Location: Pearl Studios: 500 8th Ave, 12th flr (btw 35th & 36th St), NYC

Rate: Try Naach Xpress for only $20 (for drop-in first class) and/or discount packages of 5 or 10 classes thereafter. Get ready to feel the joy and burn as you groove, sweat and dance your heart out...AND get a great workout!

Reserve your spot now:
Click on BFunk Naach Xpress (Valid for first lesson only) http://bollywoodfunknyc.com/General/new-york-city.html For more info and class packages:www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

results.description:
What Others Are Saying

"With all the negative news on climate and Congress it's understandable to feel discouraged. But hopelessness is not a strategy for making a difference and neither is acting alone. Citizens' Climate Lobby is the antidote, the missing link, the Harvard of citizen activism." ---

Sam Daley-Harris Founder, RESULTS, Microcredit Summit Campaign, and the Center for Citizen Empowerment and Transformation
"Most impressive is the work of Citizens' Climate Lobby...If you want to join the fight to save the planet, to save creation for your grandchildren, there is no more effective step you could take than becoming an active member of this group." ---

Dr. James Hansen Climate scientist and former head of the NASA Goddard Institute
"The Citizens' Climate Lobby has identified the issue of pricing carbon as a vitally important lever in promoting dialog and action on climate protection. If you've been looking for that one group to join, you can stop looking now." ---

Dr. Daniel Kammen Professor - University of California, Berkeley
To learn more about Citizens' Climate Lobby visit
www.citizensclimatelobby.org and register for a one hour introductory conference call:
https://citizensclimatelobby.org/join-weekly-intro-call/
This conference call is held almost every Wednesday night.
Here is a sample introductory call. http://www.citizensclimatelobby.org/calls/CCL-intro-call-sample.mp3

VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: Don't let a very-low RSVP sign up number on the Meet-Up site discourage you from attending. The call is advertised in other places nation-wide. People who are already members attend local meetings and may not RSVP to the meetings listed on meetup.
results.name: Learn how you can generate the political will for a stable climate.

Come for a FREE TRIAL Class at Movement Bliss Studio. Call[masked] or email [masked]

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Doors close at 8:10p.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10. For info contact Aubrey at [masked]

If you can't make this one, visit us at www.turnonnyc.us
results.name: TurnON Manhattan

Starting in October we'll be hosting D&D Encounters in our store. Until then, we'll be running adventures on Wednesdays. Whether you're a seasoned veteran or are just learning D&D for the first time, this is a great way to play.

We'll be using the new system (known as D&D Next or 5.0) for our adventures.


At the moment we only have 1 Dungeon Master (DM), so space is limited to 6 players. Be sure to RSVP if you plan to show up!

We're always looking for more DM's, so if you're interested feel free in becoming a DM, please contact us.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Doors close at 8:10p.

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.


For info contact Aubrey at [masked]

If you can't make this one, visit us at www.turnonnyc.us

results.description:
Join us for a 45-minute cross-training workout designed to build strength, flexibility and endurance in your running fitness. Each of our workouts is created and led by a certified coach who will take care to ensure you have proper form and get the most out of every session.  Best of all, tonight's session will be totally free-of-charge!

The workout will consist of a fast-paced circuit of  movement exercises and short runs that will help you to develop specific muscles, leaving you with the capacity to be stronger, faster and less prone to injury after only a few sessions. 

Pricing:
Your first session is always free to try - we want you to know what you’re signing up for. 

**THIS SESSION IS FREE-OF-CHARGE! JOIN US AND ENJOY A GREAT WORKOUT**

One month of unlimited cross-training workouts is available for $30. Two months of unlimited cross-training are yours for only $50. 


Disclaimer:
All fitness programs come with some risk of injury. By agreeing to participate, you confirm that you’re of adequate fitness that you can comfortably run 3-4 miles at a time. Please let your coach know of any injuries or conditions that may limit your ability to complete this session safely - safety is of primary importance, and your coach will do everything possible to make the workout safe, fun and rewarding. 

- - - - - - 
Please see our full calendar of events
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/
- - - - - -

results.description:
"And The King of All Sir Duke..."

Formed in the summer of 2013, Sir Duke quickly became an instant hit as New York's ultimate Stevie Wonder tribute band.  Fronted by the electrifying and world-famous vocalist, Tom Bowes (formerly of Tower of Power and Blood, Sweat & Tears), Sir Duke lifts the level of the tribute band genre to something riveting and absolutely unforgettable. Like his bandmates, Bowes grew up listening to and learning from Stevie’s music “until it wore off the vinyl” and you will hear his love of it in every lyric and vocal nuance.

Steve Briody, a Grammy-nominated guitarist and Sir Duke’s musical director, handpicked these nine stellar musicians, featuring a tight rhythm section that has played together for over fifteen years!  The result was an explosive combination of vocals and rhythm that honors and celebrates the musicality and songwriting genius of the inspirational Stevie Wonder.  The camaraderie between the members on stage is palpable and only adds to their already rocking performances.

Sir Duke invites you to come experience your favorite Stevie Wonder hits("I Just Called to Say I Love You", "Isn't She Lovely") live in a captivating show you will not soon forget.  This group of talented musicians always looks forward to sharing their love of this music with each other on stage and with their faithful audiences at every performance.

                          http://www.sirduketribute.com/


                                  Echo Park Pool Complex

                                  399 Nassau Boulevard

                                 West Hempstead, NY 11552

       Please call[masked] ext. 7382 for concert information
results.name: Sir Duke Tribute Band-Stevie Wonder

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street


East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Jul 29, 2015-Sep 02, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  Level 1: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631555754<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Auto Mechanic

• Cleaning Service

• Florist

• Handyman or women

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!

MID PARK BEHIND REC CENTER @ HANDBALL COURTS (MAP ON THIS LINK) https://www.facebook.com/CatGarloFitness/photos/gm.383293988527791/596413443794335/?type=1&theater

HIIT, as the name suggests, combines high-intensity, calorie-torching periods of activity with low-intensity recovery periods for an overall duration of as little as 10 minutes each session. Some studies have shown that HIIT burns up to nine times more fat than traditional cardiovascular exercise and keeps your metabolism elevated for more than 24 hours afterwards. This means you are going to keep burning calories long after you have finished exercising.

Boot Camp Workout. This intense circuit keeps your heart rate up, burns calories, and tones your whole body. With these circuits we will use body weight exercises alternating with calisthenics.

I am offering 1 week free, then a 15.00 contribution to workout material is appreciated per week. 

please watch my video to get an idea of how much fun we can have getting that beach body!  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SEfy9XKiqQc

please visit my website: catgarlo.com

results.description:
[EVENT IS FULL, RSVP IS CLOSED]
(location will be emailed to qualified registrants)

Join us for this fun-filled CTO Breakfast event exclusively for CTOs, CIOs, IT Leadership and equivalent Sr. Tech-Executives. This totally free event will include a sumptuous breakfast, ample networking with CTOs and stimulating intellectual discussion about modern cloud-based applications and how to overcome the constraints of traditional database infrastructure.

We will also feature a presentation from Seth Proctor, NuoDB CTO, who will discuss how modern applications require a database that can:

- Span multiple geographies / data centers
- Deliver elasticity
- Provide high performance even with heavy application usage
- Offer around-the-clock resiliency and uptime

Seth will lead an interactive discussion about ways that organizations like yours are meeting the challenges associated with building new cloud-apps or migrating existing applications to the cloud.

Featured Speaker: Seth Proctor, CTO, NuoDB

Seth has 15+ years of experience in the research, design and implementation of scalable systems. His particular focus is on how to make technology scale and how to make users scale effectively with their systems.

* Please note: this is an exclusive event for CTOs, senior IT leaders and technology-executives/VPs. Venue location will only be provided to qualified-attendees after we verify your registration.
results.name: CTO Breakfast - Theme: Architecting for the Cloud

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
